Reviews.Title: “Great location to meet our new granddaughter!”
Reviews.Author: Hank828
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC to meet our new granddaughter born at NYU Langone Medical Center. This hotel was a gret location..only 6 blocks from the hospital. An easy walk. The staff at the Ramada Eastside (esp.the front desk) were great..trying to be helpful with any request we had ,even helping hail a taxi to Penn Station . And the complimentary breakfast was good..pastry,bagels, donuts,hard-boiled eggs,yogurt, assorted cereal and on and on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cheaper Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sandieck
Reviews.Content: King room does not have a refrigerator and microwave like advertised, only some of the queen rooms do. Staff was accommodating with my concern that my room didn't have what was advertised. Be aware that this hotel also charges extra for more than one person. King room was a typical small NY room with a nice memory foam bed with lots of pillows. Nice flat screen TV with Showtime. Bathroom has a bit of counter space (more than some NY rooms) and a shower/tub with a nice adjustable shower head. Toiletries were good and included conditioner. Internet is free and fast. Air conditioner was fine, not too noisy. Breakfast room has beagles, doughnuts, instant oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, toast, cereal, fruit, milk and juices. Lots of good restaurants in the area, I just wish the subway was a little closer but it's not too far away. I will stay here again and be sure to sign up for Wyndham Rewards so you can earn free stays too.

Reviews.Title: “ROOM SMELLS NEWLY PAINTED CAUSED ME CHEST PAINS”
Reviews.Author: renato m
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night and the room smell newly painted. I went to the front desk and told Ms. Julie as I remember her and her answer was the other room was newly painted that is her reason why I was smelling paint in my room. I just said to myself that isn't awkward to give that reason? Number 1- I did not smell the paint in the hallway, so how come the smell of paint will come from the other room? Going to our room? Isn't kinda weird excuse? Secondly, I was not offered to transfer to another room. I just said to myself I could probably tolerate it, but unfortunately the morning I woke up, I am feeling chest pain because of the smell. I didn't brought it up anymore when I check-out anyway there are other hotel around the same area that are not that expensive and hotel staff are better that them. I just reported them to the Department of Health for this.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: SairBo
Reviews.Content: Great location for a hotel. Lots of local bars and restaurants to choose from. Staff were polite and helpful. Breakfast facilities were good, with plenty of bagels and doughnuts on offer. Only issue was the size of the room, which is pretty small but that is NYC standard. Also, watch out for the NYC taxes which are included on the end of your bill. We definitely got bitten! Tip: Head to the bar next door for some drinks which is full of energy. Perfect when you're a little jet-lagged but eager to push your sleep boundaries. The staff are colourful and the food is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “more than OK for 109 + tax”
Reviews.Author: ervine
Reviews.Content: OK location. Well-run. Staff smiles, no bugs, everything works. Reasonable rates translate into >> smallish rooms - but clean. Great mattresses ! Breakfast ! Would go for it again. >> Wine & cheese restaurant on the premises too cheesy for me, sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, cozy bed, quiet neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: LoriKSacto
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. I got a great price, the room was small (as expected) but with terrific features like the temperpedic bed, wifi, nice toiletries, and it was very clean! The breakfast was much nicer than I expected, too, with a fairly big breakfast room. They have all sorts of bagels, breads, cereal, hard boilled eggs, fruit, yogurt etc. Also this is a nice quiet neighborhood, easy to access with transit, and felt very safe. We had no problems whatsoever with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A B
Reviews.Content: Unlike most hotels in NYC, Ramada Eastside offers free wifi and breakfast. Rooms are not big, but clean, comfortable and new. Location is quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: devverma
Reviews.Content: Do not go by the brand name.. they are worse than a service apartment/hostel or dormitory..The room was toooooo small.. It was a horrible experience.. Not a value for money deal.. Should not be even the last choice of hotel to stay

Reviews.Title: “Make yourself at home”
Reviews.Author: Iheartny_82
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Eastside will from now on be my hotel of choice when staying in NYC. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, pillows fluffy. The only issue I had was noise coming from the wall. According to staff the knocking noise coming from the wall was caused by heating in the pipes. They did offer a different room, but I decided just to deal with it, it wasn't all that bad. I do recall reserving a queen with a microwave and mini fridge, room 711 did not have either. But pull the curtains back, and the Empire State Building was gleaming a beautiful blue. The heater did not always work, however, a quick call to the front desk and they had a portable heater sent to the room. Breakfast was from 6am-10am, and I liked that it was in its own separate area away from the lobby. Times square is about a 30 minute walk from the hotel, or you can catch the 6 train a few blocks up on 28th ave. The Empire State Building is a quick 5-10 minute walk from hotel. Staff was friendly, I had an overall pleasant experience, and will definitely be staying here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: astute4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Eastside for the second time last fall and I have had it on my mind that I ought to write a nice review even though time has passed! The first night the safe didn't work and I reported it and the next morning we were given another room, with two queen beds, a microwave, fridge and just lots of space! WE were surprised and delighted that the front desk was nice enough to upgrade us! We had a pleasant stay, close to restaurants, the subway and a nice quiet neighborhood. I would stay there again any time!

Reviews.Title: “If you need internet access, look elsewhere -- otherwise a fine value”
Reviews.Author: ThePlainsman
Reviews.Content: Generally, I like this hotel, and I've stayed here regularly. There is much good to be said about it, and I've reviewed it favorably before. I like the Apple Core Hotels, and this one in particular. Unfortunately, I'm beginning to look elsewhere for one reason: Internet access is important. Yes, they have free wifi access to the internet, but it is the tragedy of the commons: It is open to the neighborhood, no password required, and so there is little to no reliable internet access for guests. It is quite obvious that the hotel's connection is shared by many within wireless reach. This is much more apparent in the evening, but it is true at all hours. I wish I could do without, but it is essential for business. I've written the management about this but it has not changed and now it is time to look elsewhere. If the breakfast food were similarly open to the neighborhood, they would surely take notice and act, but the internet access problem is less apparent and obvious and so the problem continues.

Reviews.Title: “A Helluva Stay In A Helluva Town”
Reviews.Author: NeedPivo
Reviews.Content: Centrally situated in the Murray Hill neighborhood of Midtown Manhattan, the Ramada Eastside stands elegantly on the corner of Lexington Avenue. All this and a well maintained place to stay at a reasonable rates. Step through the automatic doors, away from the honking and hustling of the street, and you are in the small, but comfortable, lobby: to the left is a door leading to a courtyard; on the right, adjacent to the elevators, is the entrance to the quaint breakfast room, where guests can fill their gullets with coffee, juices, bagels, cereals, pastries and such. In the center sits the front desk - where your stay begins. The room is as basic as they come; not too big, none too small (Goldilocks would be content). Of course, there is the flat-screen TV â€“ because watching it will, no doubt, be your primary reason for being in the Worldâ€™s Greatest City. There is the in-room coffee machine and a queen-sized bed with its very comfortable mattress. Comfortable, clean and everything a guest should need. The bathroom I thought to be a tad small â€“ unless you are a small tad; however, it was clean, well-stocked with enough toiletries (for me, anyway) and provided a shower with an adequate stream. (Not enough to blast away skin, but definitely no trickle.) All in all, I would surely stay here again if the rates were reasonable enough â€“ as New York hotels rates are during January. The Ramada Eastside makes for an enjoyable stay when taking a bite from the Big Apple. (Iâ€™ll bet this is the first review to use that phrase.)

Reviews.Title: “Another Applecore hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoolYule
Reviews.Content: Though I prefer the Hotel @ Times Square (for location mostly), this is another very good hotel from the group. Stayed here a few times, as well. Very reasonable prices, great housekeeping (across the board in this group), convenient location. Only issue I had was with the plumbing - but that was more so an issue with the building than the hotel. The staff was very responsive and issue was immediately solved (and I do mean IMMEDIATELY). A very well-run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A surprise”
Reviews.Author: csf1
Reviews.Content: Was very dubious of this two star hotel. I got a 12th floor room, king bed, small, clean, small bathroom, bad pillows, good mattress, bad old style bedspread, good TV, loud AC/heater, pedestrian breakfast (but there was a breakfast), weak coffee, for $159. on this almost holiday weekend. Who can argue with the value? I give it a B+ and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect anything above average”
Reviews.Author: Nick T
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the location is good, but at $250/night the service was pretty average. I accidentally double-booked myself into the hotel, and the manager wasn't interested in helping me out. Just repeated the "it's policy to charge you" line, regardless of the fact I still had a few nights to stay there, and that there were dozens of rooms available. It seemed to be a cultural thing, as even asking for directions or advice from hotel staff was met with a shrug of the shoulders and a can't-be-bothered attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Good value central NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattyb8
Reviews.Content: Reasonable quality hotel for reasonable price in central NYC. Great location near metro for exploring NYC as very central, but only problem is that the immediate surrounding area doesn't have a lot of cafes or bars, so whilst it was perfect as a base for our first trip to explore NYC, next time I'll look for a more funky neighbourhood. OK rooms, small but clean. OK reception staff, breakfast was free but poor quality. From our room we could see both Empire State and Chrysler buildings, which was a nice touch. Not too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Kauaidudette
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Inn Eastside is in a renovated older building. The location is Lexington and East 30th Street. During rush hour you can walk one block to Third Ave to catch cabs to the west side. Good location. My room was on the small'ish side but very comfortable. The bed was really comfortable and the furnishings were updated, modern and very clean. Bathroom was very nice size. While it did not matter to me, the clost was midget sized. Hanging my knee length rain coat meant that the hem dragged on the floor. The staff was very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good find in Murray Hill area”
Reviews.Author: Kazza59
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was great. Not outlandishly expensive as most hotels in NYC seem to be. The rooms were small but included a fridge, microwave, flat screen hotel and tea & cofee making. The hotel provided a complimentary breakfast which was great. It is a five minute walk to the closest subway.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Buzzino_10
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Eastside was a good choice for my wife and I when we visited relatives in New York City for 4 days over the 2011 Thanksgiving Day weekend. The price was reasonable by New York standards, the rooms were clean and the hotel staff members were pleasant. Having free in-room internet service and a free continental breakfast is a big plus. We'll certainly consider staying there again the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Ramada Eastside Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lholz46
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Eastside Hotel is very well situated for a visit when arriving at Grand Central Station. It is a reasonably priced hotel in the Murray Hill section of New York City with many and diversely ethnic restaurants. If you enjoy good Indian cuisine it abuts Little India(East 20s) It has a free internet connection, continental breakfast and a small but pleasant fitness center. The hotel staff is efficient and helpful and the rooms are clean. The fairly recent addition of the High Line(rail to trail) across town makes for a great walking situation...(see review)...

Reviews.Title: “Won't ever stay anywhere else in NYC!!!”
Reviews.Author: apr68
Reviews.Content: What a HUGE find! This hotel is in a safe, New York City neighborhood with restaurants and stores all around. You can easily walk to your favorite destinations or take an inexpensive cab ride. The best part is the PRICE. I have stayed in many hotels in NYC and have always spent at minimum $300 per night. With our AAA discount, we spent about $165 per night. Amazing. I was very leary, thinking that because the price was cheap, that the hotel would be cheap. WRONG! Very nice, good sized rooms for NY standards. Temperdic beds in each room. Small bathroom in our King bed room, but my kids had 2 queens and the bathroom was a good size. Very clean and nice decor. Superb staff - very helpful and super nice. The breakfast was a traditional continental, but better. The bagels were NY fresh bagels, hard boiled eggs were warm in a crockpot, the waffles were already made. There was yogurt, donuts, fresh fruits, cereal, juices, coffee/tea, and milk. We probably save hundreds of dollars by eating in the hotel each morning as there was 12 of us!! I can't find one thing wrong with this hotel. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: iwillgothere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, very safe, close to everything. The staff were very helpful, knowledgable and friendly. They split our bill 4 ways and allowed different methods of payment, There is a safe in the room. Standard breakfast had a variety of foods and there was no shortage compared to what I have seen at other hotels. The room (we had 2 double beds) was larger than another NYC hotel I have stayed at. Only suggestion I could make is request a room away from the elevators if you can. I am a light sleeper and woke up a few times, my friends were not bothered at all. I am rating this as a 5 based on a 3.5 start hotel, not as a 5 star. I have recommended it to friends and would stay here again. *** Also to note, Cask restaurant is a few blocks away and fantastic and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Kosher breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Naftoli
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 8 nights. The room was spacious and convinient breakfast was included in the rate. Breakfast is served with plastic plates and silverwares and the products are kosher.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: adeponte
Reviews.Content: The accommodation in NY is always expensive but it's great when you find a nice hotel, in a great location, and you can enjoy your stay without thinking you have been ripped off! The rooms are very good, comfy king-size beds and clean bathroom with powerful shower, great after all day walking around the city! The breakfast is varied although you have to wait for a free table in the busy hour (from 8 to 9) The location is great as it is in the middle of manhattan, walking distance to Empire State Building, Shopping Area, Chrysler Building, Grand Central Terminal, etc... and really close to a subway station to go down to Soho and Wall Street or up to Central Park and Harlem. Also, there are a bunch of really good restaurant in the area: don't miss Vezzo or Penelope!

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING like a Ramada experience should be”
Reviews.Author: Wheelygal
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here for the weekend hole visiting my boyfriend and had booked in here to get over jetlag. I'm a wheelchair user, so obv have specific requirements when booking a room anywhere. When I arrived, I found the room to be on the top floor (what if there was an emergency?), no shower seat in the accessible shower-I mean this is common sense people! If you are immobile and want tO take a shower, you need SOMETHING to sit on! I must admit, within being in the place a half hr, was getting concerned and ready to check out, but thought I'd persist due to the price it cost! Never again will stay here, will stay where I know has the proper facilities

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: ange1971
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was one of only a few decent places in NYC that wasn't charging $400-$500 per night for a room. It's in a good location for exploring the city with the 28th St/Lexington Ave subway only a few blocks away. The Flatiron Building, Empire State and shopping on Broadway are all within walking distance. We even walked back to the hotel from Central Park! Took about half an hour but was a pleasant walk in the sunshine. Three restaurants next door to the hotel were great too (Penelope's, Lalisse and Belvedere Trattoria). Now for the negatives - the impression we got from management is that they are more focused on dollars than customer service. For one entire day all guests were without hot water yet we had to ask for a discount on that day's rate at check out rather than one being offered and even then it was only 10%. The very ordinary breakfast is served until 10.00am and I was very surprised to see an employee lock the door smack bang on 10.00am so as guests who may have been a little late couldn't get in! We were already in the breakfast room and my son wanted more juice but surprise surprise the machine had been turned off. This was the day after the no hot water incident too so I wasn't terribly impressed. If I had the funds to pay more next time I would otherwise this place does the job so long as you're happy with second rate breakfasts and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Gary T
Reviews.Content: Great value for Manhattan, New York City. Had 2 rooms, one good sized one with a fridge and microwave and one smaller one. The smaller room with 2 queen sized beds is a bit tight to pass to get to the bathroom. The larger room was very comfortable. Most Manhattan hotels only allow 2 adults per room. We were 5 adults and the desk staff let that slide without charging me extra for the 5th adult. A tip of the hat to Ramada for that! The only negative thing I can think of are the bathrooms. 1- Bathroom doors are glass. If you are traveling with a frequent nighttime pee'er be prepared for lights on every 2 hours. If you like your privacy when doing your business you will find it hard when sharing a room cuz anyone that walks by can see you sitting on the pot. 2- No ventilation fan in bathroom. 6 beers, a steak, garlic crusted pizza, 4 eggs, black beans, tacos and a club sandwich with a mountain of coleslaw and no bathroom ventilation fan. Needless to say my roommates were not happy with me! Positive things: - This hotel is close to everything! Manhattan is only 17 miles wide and 30 miles long, every hotel is close to everything this one included. - It's in a great neighborhood with lots of good eats that aren't crazy prices. - There are tons and tons of shops just minutes from the hotel. - Rooms were very, very clean. - No bugs of any sort at all. - Early check in and late check out at no charge. We took advantage of the early check in. - Free luggage storage if you need it pre-check in or post check out. - And get this; FREE breakfast! Bagels, cream cheese, sweet cakes, donuts, toast, butter, coffee, tea, fresh fruit, cereals, waffles, boiled eggs, jam, peanut butter, milk, orange juice, apple juice, cranberry juice and more. This easily saved us 50 to 60 dollars a day in food expense. Not to mention the time we saved by not having to go to a restaurant and wait to be served. - Hotel staff is friendly and helpful. - Elevators worked better then expected - Iron and ironing board were clean and functional. - Hotel safe was in working condition and large enough to accommodate a couple of 10 inch screen laptops. - Plenty of toilet paper, Kleenex, pens, pads, cups etc. - Plenty of towels, soap, shampoo etc. - Heating and AC was operational and effective. - Upholstery, bed covers and linens were clean and in excellent shape. - Carpeting clean and not worn. - Paint and pictures were clean and in very good shape (richly decorated too.) - Rooms are smoke detector equipped. - Furniture was all functional and in good shape, no visible dings, dents or major scratches. - Decent quality flat screen TV was functional. - All lamps and lighting were functional - Clock radio with alarm was functional. - All curtains, curtain rods and blinds were large enough and functional. - Door locks and peep hole were functional. - Fridge and microwave was spotless and functional. - Closet was large enough with a dozen hangers. - Free Wireless Internet access was operational at all times and easy to access. - Tempur-Pedic mattresses as advertised was in excellent condition. - Free calls anywhere in the USA (good to catch up with old friends!) Asides: The amount of retail in Manhattan is astounding. Exit the hotel walk west a few blocks and then head north or south and get your wallet ready because you really can shop till you drop in this city. The breakfast is available from 6:30 to 10:00. Don't show up at 9:50 and whine about there not being much left. A question that is often asked about hotels is: Did you feel safe and secure sleeping there with your kids and wife? The answer for this hotel is yes, absolutely. There were no strange noises and no lunatic party people. After a day and night of walking Manhattan every one in this hotel beds down and goes to sleep. Taxi stuff you need to know: Manhattan taxis do not have radios. If you call for a cab they will pick you up but they will charge you 3 to 5 times the price of flagging one down on the street. So a 12 dollar ride on the street can be 60 bucks if you call it in. The cabbies don't care how many people you are or what you are carrying. If you fit in the cab they will take you. Just be quick about getting in and don't complain that you are squished. Every taxi I rode in without exception needed front end work. Shocks, springs, tie rods, ball joints and tires. Thankfully their brakes all worked! If you're knowledgeable about cars some of the rides will make you want to tell the cabbie to pull over so you can check it. If you can't get a cab there are the car service guys driving some nice and some not so nice limos. They cost 30 to 100 percent more then a yellow cab but hey, you get to drive in a Lincoln Continental limo! Leather seats and air ride suspension! You feel like a million buck being chauffeured around Manhattan in one of those babies especially a newer one. Besides it's fun to do a least once to impress the kids and wife. Bargain with them and they will bargain back and always tell them that the price includes the tip. Don't be shy, certainly these drivers aren't! If you are nervous about getting into an unmarked car check their license plate on the back of the vehicle it will be marked T&LC under the plate number. This stands for the taxi and limousine commission. The driver will or should have his permit taped to the dashboard in plain site. I used these guys 3 times during my stay. Between 3 and 7 p.m. getting a taxi can be difficult. However because they are more expensive an independent limo is easier to come by during rush hour. Purely on a person note there is something special about barreling up 5th avenue in 60 mile an hour bursts in a limo with the windows open, dodging cars and obstacles like a scene out of a movie. That alone was worth the price of admission. Just tell him your late! Have fun in NYC peeps and don't forget to bring lots of spending money.

Reviews.Title: “Good-average hotel in midtown, beds great, breakfast poor”
Reviews.Author: slickricspain
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights at the Eastside so had plenty of time to relfect on the good and the bad of thsi hotel. The hotel itself is good overall -rooms are a good size, with ample windows, coffee facilities, free wifi, comfortable beds and pillows and relatively noise-free. The hotel would be very good if it could fix two things. First, the breakfast! It is buffet style, but here is the rub. You only get plastic plates and cutlery, have to queue to get a table and then are ordered to clean your own table after eating! I can stand the lack of fresh fruit, freshly cooked eggs and bacon, lack of variety, lack of fresh fruit juice etc but not the lack of service. Second, the rooms have very old fashioned aircon units...noisy and not very effective. Pity, because the hotel could be a lot more..it is in a good location and is not overly expensive,

Reviews.Title: “Not use to pay $350 a night for a closet!”
Reviews.Author: Emi A
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the place was very clean. The daily breakfast included in the price was OK but the size of the room was very very small. Two queen beds took over the room. We wanted a King size bed but it was not available so we took the two bed room. We have to jump over one of the beds to get to the bathroom. There was no room to walk around. It was the size of a regular european room but with big beds!

Reviews.Title: “Regular visitor - good choice on Lexington Ave”
Reviews.Author: linksrat
Reviews.Content: I am a regular visitor to New York for work, and my colleagues and I have found the Ramada Eastside to be a great value and a worthwhile choice for us. Clean, large, comfortable rooms (not the norm in this area) with a very good staff and free breakfast are all features that bring us back every week. Wireless internet in the room is a must when we travel, and there are many affordable restaurants in the nearby walking area. Rates are very reasonable for New York, and particularly for this part of it. Within a short walk of Empire State and Grammercy Park areas. Dunkin Donuts one block away doesn't hurt either!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Barowner2
Reviews.Content: There was five of us in our party. We booked two rooms - one king and one double. Both rooms were clean and a nice size for New York hotel rooms. The staff was very helpful & polite. The breakfast was a nice extra but the coffee was not so good. Very close to everything without all the hustle & bustle of Time Square. I would recommand this hotel to anyone. Also you can not beat the price for NYC hotel. They also give AAA discount. We stayed four nights and the discount really helped. Overall a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great location, good price.”
Reviews.Author: CA7777
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, small midtown hotel with good sized rooms for the price. Beds are new, bathroom had nice towels and toiletries. Cleaning staff were thorough and friendly. The breakfast buffet was basic, with convenient hours. Friendly front desk staff. Very short walk to subway or bus lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Decent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Marivo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in mid July 2011 for 4 nights. This was during the heatwave so we really tested their airconditioning, which thankfully worked great! The location of this hotel is very close to the Empire State Building, and short walk (10 minutes?) away from the Broadway and 5th and all that jazz. The value of the hotel considering the location is great. It's not RIGHT in the middle of the action but it's not far away. There's also "curry hill" on your doorstep for those that like an Indian meal! Although very nice the curry we had didn't quite compare to those I'm used to in the UK. But certainly worth going if you need a curry! There's also a very nice Italian next door to hotel. The room we had was a good size for Manhattan, and as mentioned about the air con worked very well. The room was also clean and had the usual items in the bathroom; soaps and shower gel and shower caps etc...etc... There was no mini bar / fridge which was a small downside, but nothing major. The inclusive continental breakfast was very handy, and not common in New York, and was a good start to the day. The selection was good, boiled eggs, cereal, bread/toast, waffles, juice, yogurts, fresh fruit (be quick it goes fast) along with coffee and tea and all the jams and syrups you'd expect etc... no bacon, which would have made it perfect, but for free you can't complain about that. What I could complain about is the plates, cups and cutlery. The plates and cups were polysterene and the knifes and forks were plastic. While these are not brilliant to eat with the main issue was the amount of waste generated by this method. I am not sure what the reason was to use these items, presumably not having to replace broken items, so they aren't stolen, or not having to employ a dishwasher. Whatever the reason seeing the mound of waste in the bins every day did not sit very well with me. It left an increasingly bad taste in the mouth with each day. This is the major reason the hotel lost a point. Another point to mention about the breakfast is that the room is pretty small with not many tables for the size of the hotel. So at peak times you may have to wait for a table. We were lucky as when it was busy we managed to time it quite well and a table was leaving as we arrived, but I can imagine that you could easily have to wait a few minutes for a table. Apart from this I can't really think of any other issues. It's not luxury, but then in manhattan for the price, people really shouldn't expect it. I found the staff pleasant and helpful when asked anything, and the hotel looked clean and neat. We happened across a couple of alternative hotels we were considering for this trip and we were more than happy we picked this hotel as the other options looked run down and not in as nice an area as this hotel. I would defintiely consider staying here again when visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay with only one issue”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelGuru68
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this particular hotel and have never had any real issues. The rooms have Tempur-Pedic beds, HDTV, coffee maker, that wonderful Sugared Citrus soap and shampoos, and a massaging shower head. Very conveniently located, close to transportation and dining. My only issue was during check in. I booked a King Smoking. When I arrived at my room, it was King, but non-smoking. When I went back to reception to have the room changed, she kept insisting that I had booked a non-smoking room. It wasn't until I showed my confirmation printout that she told me they didn't have any King smoking rooms available. I was given a Queen smoking. Because it was only for one night, it wasn't an issue, but a guest should be contacted if the room they booked is no longer available. Other than this issue, it's a lovely hotel. The breakfast was decent and filling. There seemed to be enough of each item left when I went down, about 9AM. Overall, I liked this property and will most likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Minor annoyances.”
Reviews.Author: Amys_husband
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation about a week in advance. I knew I'd be working late, so I specified a late check in. I asked for a non smoking room away from the elevator. I received a smoking room directly across from the elevator bank. The guy at the desk apologized and offered $20 off. At 1:30 am I really didn't feel like arguing. The room did not smell from smoke at all and the elevators were fairly quite. The room was clean and typical. It was about 15' x 15' with a small bathroom. Flat screen tv was mounted on the wall above a desk. The shower was like a torrential downpour. I've never seen a shower push out that much water. The final cost was $179 after the $20 off. All in all, it was a decent experience. If I stay here again, I'll check in earlier so I get the room I want.

Reviews.Title: “No issues”
Reviews.Author: ddkphotos
Reviews.Content: I read the mixed reviews on this hotel and was a bit afraid but it's what fell within my budget. I didn't have any issues with the front desk staff, the rooms were clean (no sign of alleged bedbugs or cockroaches), the air conditioning was plenty - thank goodness because I went there on the hottest day of the year! Breakfast was fine - not super deluxed and I can imagine if you go 5 minutes before it's over they might be running low on stuff - but there was enough choice... Not alot of seating for breakfast - so met someone new one of the mornings. My only complaint is that my room faced Lexington and the noise from constant traffic was a bit distracting - bring your ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. The only other suggestion I'd make is that they add a towel rack somewhere in the bathroom...

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs in hotel room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Turkiyr
Reviews.Content: On 16 th of june 2011 we went to NY and stayed at ramada inn east side hotel which is on Lexington Ave.At first night many of bedbugs bite my arm,shoulder etc. When i turned back to my country I went to doctor and told me that i These are bedbug bites.All a long my holiday I felt terrible because of bites.I want to allert everyone not to stay in that hotel Ramada inn east side in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: desertperson87
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located.Lots of great restaurants nearby. The hotel staff was very helpful and the continental breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust staff...”
Reviews.Author: albumimagery
Reviews.Content: Was a decent enough room and relatively clean. The problem we had were the constant upsells, "where are you going?", "I can get that for you for $$$", etc... When we checked out, we had car service picking us up later in the day, so we asked them to keep our luggage until then, they agreed and locked our bags in a back room, but when we came back to retrieve them, we noticed that they had been opened. NOT COOL.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: petlady1
Reviews.Content: We have been going to NYC for years. When we lost our pied-a-terre there after my uncle sold his coop (boo-hoo), we had to stay in hotels like everyone else. Sticker shock!!! We occasionally got a good deal at a boutique hotel off-season, but those became available less and less and have evaporated entirely. I should add we are terrified of BEDBUGS!!! After reading some of the reviews here, we decided to give the Ramada Eastside a chance. Recently, we stayed there for our second time. We have booked a king room both times. The desk staff is friendly enough, although no one has ever offered to take our luggage for us and there is no doorman (that said, the outside doors are automatic, like at the supermarket!). But if someone needed assistance, I imagine they would be able to render it. Both times, the room has been scrupulously clean, and the bed very comfortable. I will mention they use tempurpedic beds, which I find sleep a little too warm, but lots of people like them. I always check the mattress and underneath (see bedbug phobia cited above), and everything is always spotless. The sheets are also good quality. For the price, room size is pretty good. Coffee makers in the room. Shower was fine as far as water pressure and temp. Plenty of clean towels. Free continental breakfast served 6:30-10AM (the usual suspects, --bagels, croissants, various muffiny things, hard-boiled eggs, Yoplait yogurt, bananas, apples, oranges, 3 kinds of cereal (all sugary). Unless you come early, there is no place to sit in the "breakfast" room, since I think there are 101 rooms and maybe seats for 30 people tops, if strangers sit at the same table (which never happened). On the second AM, we grabbed our stuff and juggled it back to our room. NY was having record-breaking heat last weekend, and we did find that the A/C was NOT up to the task. It helped, but set at coolest, the room was still warmer than we would have liked. Checkout was fast (almost never saw any sort of line at the front desk, despite the fact that there only ever seems to be one person there at a time). They happily locked up our bags for safe-keeping after check out so that we could spend the rest of the day in the city. Access to public transport, subway and bus, is nearby. We like this neighborhood, because it's quiet at night. It's easy to get up- or down-town, and you can't beat the price. Also, for those driving in, they have a deal with a lot a block or so away for $20/night. If that sounds like a lot, you haven't parked overnight in NYC lately. Can't speak for how well the free WiFi works, since we usually just use our smart phones. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: go-kiwi-3805
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this hotel and were very pleased. The room was clean and amenities were plentiful. We were very pleased to have a refrigerator and microwave in the room as this saved us some bucks eating out (after visiting a nearby grocery store). Breakfast was good and we had none of the problems that others indicated they had. I would agree that the staff could have been friendlier at times, but when we asked questions, they were very helpful. Even got us a car to the airport. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is ok”
Reviews.Author: Minhtrung1811
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not horrible but not very clean either. Staffs are not very friendly and hotel is not really in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “We were quite pleased with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wings
Reviews.Content: 2 Families travelling, so requested 2 rooms, each requiring 2 double beds in each room. Since we booked together, you would assume, the 2 rooms would be on same floor. However note, that this hotel has a max of 2 double rooms on each floor, both by the elevator. The room to the right is the best as it is very spacious. the double room to the left, as we compared with the other family, is quite cramped, and you have to squeeze by the bed to get to the bathroom, although they made do, our room was far more comfortable. We checked thoroughly for bedbug traces and found no sign. Bed very comfortable. Air conditioning worked great, shower had good power. Room serviced quickly and stocked every time. We stayed 4 nights. Breakfast was just fine. Yes the room was cramped, but it was not overly small. Bagels, toast, donuts were the constant. Some days had pancakes or waffles. Fruit and yoghurt as well. You could eat and get on your way. People didn't linger in the breakfast room, so space opened up. Yes, they did have a problem with the breaker, but room attendant was always there to reset and restock when required. Male reception at desk was ok. The lady there bends over backwards to help you :-) Unfortunately some people will end up with a bad experience. I get why when you are expecting a room with 2 beds, how this can set the wrong tone. However if your room type is acceptable, then I would not hesitate to stay here. Location is only a couple of blocks from Times Square. Area has alot of restaurants and a nice grocery store across the street. Oh, and our room (right of the elevator)had a bonus of a fridge! where double room on the left did not. Room prices are half of what they are in comparison to the 2 blocks closer to Times Square and this location is much quieter for sleeping. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel or stay here again. Have fun !

Reviews.Title: “Nastiest Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: worldtrvlr8
Reviews.Content: I second one of the reviews below, also from June 2011. Our room had a cockroach infestation problem as well, and we also spotted a few in the hallway. We were able to move to a different room on a different floor, which appeared to be clean enough, but not until the next morning and not until after we'd had a serious argument with the absolutely horrible front-desk staff, who insisted we were imagining the cockroaches. Based on the filthy conditions and the dreadful customer service, I would advise anyone to stay as far away as possible from this place. On the plus side, the location is good and the rooms were surprisingly up-to-date. Of course, the negatives far outweigh the positives.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, nice location, but certainly not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: tedstevens42
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean with new furnishings and the beds are comfortable.The AC works well and the location is convenient. The price is also very good for Manhattan. So fairly satisfactory for the most part. The problems? The showers were occasionally lukewarm. The wireless was spotty and kept cutting out (no plug-in ethernet). The doors slam loudly (you can tell whenever your neighbours are leaving) and the wallpaper is really awful (a pastel lime green). Minor complaints, but worth noting.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use credit cards!”
Reviews.Author: ladymarian95b
Reviews.Content: The place is actually pretty nice and in a very good location, clean and comfortable. However there are a couple of reasons why I would not recommend this hotel, expecially for people who come from outside of the US, and perhaps have a monthly limit on their credit card. When you arrive to the hotel the receptionist will swipe your credit card and try to charge the whole amount of the stay immediately (without warning you). So your credit card money will be on hold even if you, for instance, wanted to pay with another method (cash, cheque...). If you happen to not have access to all that money on your credit card immediately, they'll just lock you out of your room (still without warning you), with all your stuff inside impossible for you to reach. Secondly, the personnel is not very friendly, at least not all the personnel. You may be lucky and find a nice and helpful receptionist or, as we were, extremely unlucky and have to deal with a rude, b****y lady who won't listen to you and will make you go crazy.

Reviews.Title: “For the value, you can't beat it”
Reviews.Author: ShilotBot
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers to NYC, and decided to stay off the beaten path and away from Times and Rockefeller this time in order to have a more reasonable room. This hotel is part of a group of 5 hotels called the "Apple Core" Hotels, and this is the second we have stayed at, the first being "The Hotel at Times Square". We were not disappointed in either. Not a posh place, not a lot of extras, but clean and updated where necessary, and tastefully decorated. A short walk from main subway stations and a cheap cab ride from basically everything. Located on Lexington avenue in the Murray Hill district, which is largely residential. We will most definitely stay here again, the best value we have found in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Jodie3
Reviews.Content: After stay at another NYC hotel by the same company, I had high hopes for this hotel. My week long stay started well, but soon enough I realized that my room ha cockroaches in it. Initially in the bathroom, I then spotted them on my bedside table. After asking to switch rooms I was advised that the hotel was fully booked. This was very disappointing and made my stay unpleasant. Furthermore, one morning I spotted a cockroach in the basement hallway leading to the breakfast room. Needless to say - I didn't eat the free breakfast the following days. The room at well appointed an acceptable size for NYC at that price point. The location is OK as it's close to a subway, but there isn't much that's interesting around he hotel. I would recommend other areas before this one for tourists. All in all it was an unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect”
Reviews.Author: nannybluecar
Reviews.Content: My sister will be 70 this year and has always wanted to visit New York so I 'volunteered' to accompany her on the trip as I'd been before and knew my way around a little bit. I needed to make her stay as comfortable as possible so there were a few requirements that were essential. Top priority was a hotel in New York where you could smoke a cigarette in the room- they are LEGAL! - however majority of hotels would rather have you standing on the street and going up and down in the lift several times a day which is not really acceptable and would have spoilt the weekend. We hit the jackpot with this hotel as the room was clearly marked 'SMOKING' as requested. Next most important requirement was a bed that a) would not have bed bugs and b) would not give either of us a bad back. I have a Tempur mattress on my own bed and was amazed to see that this hotel advertized the same on their beds. When we got to the hotel I was even more amazed to see that not only was the mattress Tempur but the actual base of the bed was this VERY expensive brand. What a luxury - and completely comfortable and clean. I really don't think bed bugs can invade this solid foam mattress and we certainly didn't find any. The hotel is in a very nice area that is just far enough away from the centre to be quiet but not so far away as to be inconvenient. We easily walked to the Empire State Building to catch the Tour Bus - arranged with the front desk staff - and had a deli across the street and several restaurants close by. Duane Reed was just around the corner so I got my shopping list completed too - Dentyne Cinnamon gum, Lucky Charms, Fruity Loops, giant pots of enteric coated mini-aspirin (500! you can only buy 30 max in England! and not allowed multiple purchases), Crest 3D whitening strips and toothpaste, Band Aids in giant boxes and not assorted with all those silly sizes that you're never going to use! You may guess that I spent quite a bit in this shop and would have spent more but was dragged away by my sister. We had two queen beds and the bed linen was immaculate, there were more than enough towels in the bathroom and the shower was nice and powerful. Shower gel, soap and shampoo were provided - the soap had a lovely fruity fragrance. There was a coffe machine in the room and supplies were replenished every day without asking. Another thing you don't find as standard in New York hotels - complimentary buffet breakfast in with the price and it was very good. Plenty of choice and everything fresh. This meant that we didn't have to eat out until lunchtime which saved us quite a lot of money. The front desk staff were excellent and made our stay even better. All in all, I could not fault this hotel and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good reliable midtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cla2401
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers good value for money with reasonably quiet, comfortable, clean rooms, some helpful staff and breakfast included. Lots of places to eat and drink nearby. Free wireless. Convenient for main stations and empire state (which you can see from the fire escape)

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Noddy30
Reviews.Content: Desk & Room Service were fine. Room was small but well appointed with efficient air con, large t v screen and safe. Great bed. No fridge or microwave which one of my friends in another room had! Small but acceptable en-suite bathroom with tiny bath which was effectively a shower tray. Location was OK with 2 blocks walk to subway. Breakfast was hostel style in a functional but cramped basement room. Food was fine but yoghurts were out of date. There is no guest area other than a small lobby. There is a wine bar next door. We stayed for a week and were very satisfied. Only complaint was the building site next door which was noisy in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tricia0763
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the recommendation of a friend who works at the UN and lives nearby - he recommends it a lot to people and has not had disapointed feedback. The hotel was very clean and the staff on recetion friendly. They were helpful on the last day booking us a taxi to JFK ($55) and safeguarding our luggage in a locked room until 4pm. The bedroom itself was clean with a comfortable bed and a working TV. There was a coffee filter thing but no kettle - probably standard in the U.S. The bed had a Tempur type mattress which I actually liked (even tho' we rejected them at home recently for our own bed) but my husabnd was less sure. The bathroom was always cleaned very well each day and new towels given. (They're still not very 'green' in the States re. reusing to save water). The hotel is a block and a bit away from the nearest tube/metro but we walked a lot covering at least 7.5 miles every day according to my pedometer. We were there for 6 nights so the free breakfast did get a bit repetitive but it was more than adequate. You could eat as much as you wanted of cereal, toast, bagels - doughnuts even if that's what you fancy in the morning. They also offer some fruit. I would also say that the room was $800 dollars less for 6 nights than the one we initially found but I still think that approx $200 per room plus sooooooo many taxes is a LOT

Reviews.Title: “very clean, quiet,nice location”
Reviews.Author: ctmelody
Reviews.Content: We were in NY for the weekend and stayed here just for 1 night. We were very impressed with the cleanliness of the room and the excellent king-bed we had. The room was small but all that you need for 1 or a couple of nights. The plasma TV was the newest. Transportation is accessible and there are lots of eateries in the area. Breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: jbhawaii
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best decision when planning our trip to New York. My criteria for a hotel..2 queen beds..clean..continental breakfast..location..price and self laundry. This hotel had all that I was looking for. We were traveling as a family of 3 adults and 1 teenager. The room was "just right" considering all the reviews I had read of how small rooms can be in Manhattan. I wasn't expecting much but hoping for the best and it turned out that we were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and having continental breakfast was a great bonus. The location..awesome and surprisingly quiet. Walking distance to many sites. The metro was so close and convenient and it felt safe too. The area in general felt safe..big, big plus. The price...excellent. The staff..very helpful. Laundry..a block away. I would definitely stay here again. I've recommended this place to friends and family. That in itself says a lot. It's difficult to please people but I believe from my experience that they will like everything that I liked about this place. I wish I had wrote this review sooner but LIFE..well it gets pretty busy. Try this place. I know you'd like it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Pierro3816
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 days while tending to a friend who was having surgery at the NYU Medical Center. Very convenient location. Room was small but clean and quiet. Staff were helpful. Free continental breakfast was generous and included hard boiled eggs. Free internet. Small fitness center. Only complaint - shower took a long time to get hot and elevator was painfully slow. But all in all, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: halfpint6799
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, clean up to date style. Small but comfortable. Would stay again. Very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaOlsonGarcia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at The Ramada Eastside and really enjoyed our stay. Our room was very large by NYC standards and even came with a mini fridge and microwave which was nice for evening snacks. The room was very clean, nicely decorated and had awesome tempurpedic beds. The glass panel on the bathroom door was a little odd but other than that everything was perfect. I also really liked having the in-room coffee maker as well as the free wi fi. Breakfast was a nice perk too - it consisted of bagels, donuts, breads, fruit, oatmeal, pancakes, cereal, coffee, juices, milk and yogurt. I will definitely stay there again and am planning on a return trip this time with my mom.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleasantly suprised.”
Reviews.Author: thegormandizer
Reviews.Content: I travel for work, about 30 weeks a year, and stay at all sorts of hotels and motels, from 5 star palaces to joints I wouldnd't let my dog stay at. We chose this place as it is near where we wre working, and very inexpensive. This was the first time we stayed here, and quite frankly, were not expecting anything. What a great suprise awiated us. This is an older hotel that has been completely renovated sometime in the recent past. It is fairly modern with all of the usual amenities. The rooms are really small, but the bathrooms seem to be suprisingly large, with modern showers and faucets, and toilets. Only one of our group had a small bathroom, and even that one was reasonable in size, The place was extremely clean, and it remained that way throughout my weeks stay. The staff was always plesant and responded to any need very rapidly, going above the service I have been subjected to in much more expensive places. The beds have memory foam mattresses and pillows, and were more comfortable than almost every hotel bed I have been in during the last year. If you are planning to only use this hotel for a place to stay, for a resaonable price, in a great Manhattan location, then it is a great deal. By the way, they kick in a free continental breakfast, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: phishhead1030
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a couple days over New Years, and we had an all around great experience. It was our first time staying in the city and the hotel provided a great experience. With all the concerns of bed bugs in the city, I have to say that we went in expecting the worst, even though there was no indication anywhere that people have had issues here. We got to our room and immediately checked the mattress and the room for cleanliness, and I was very pleased on how clean the room was. The bed was comfortable and all around, the room was very cozy. The location was great, and was easily within walking distance of all the sites we wanted to see. The only minor issue that we had was on our first night after a long day of walking around and getting back later on in the evening (11:30ish) we asked the front desk if they knew of anywhere to get a bite to eat. The person at the desk sort of just stared at us and said that they didn't know of anything. Obviously being New York City, things were open, and the next day while walking around the neighborhood, we found various delis/stores that were open at that time. All in all it was a great trip, I personally would stay there again and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not stylish, but with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: HolyDuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights and had to work a bit in the evenings, so I spend quite a few hours at the desk - and I gotta say both the comfy office chair and the snappy wifi connection made it a lot kess annoying than working in hotel rooms often is. Other than that, the Ramada was pretty normal as hotels go, but a rather nice experience. Everything was servicable, the bed was nice, and the bathroom functional and clean, though on the small side. The included breakfast was basic, but again, normal as NY hotels go. It was my first stay in the Eastside, so I found the location very nice - lots of great walks up and down the avenues through many different neighbourhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and quality mattresses”
Reviews.Author: Kimbur23
Reviews.Content: Rooms (standard) are very small, especially the bathrooms., but offer high quality mattresses. Staff is excellent. Free internet and local phone calls is a plus, and the complimentary breakfast also. The rooms were recently renovated in the past few years, however,, my curtains had stains on them already, and holes in the blanket on the bed. This should not be happening so soon. Towels and sheets are changed every day,,unless you specify otherwise,,which was great. However, the actual cleaning could be improved. The same dust and stains were visible upon returning,,,,more attention needs to be paid to the cleaning. No refrigerator or microwave in the rooms..major negative point. If they improve on the above items,,,I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality!!”
Reviews.Author: NavySinger517
Reviews.Content: We planned this trip in a hurry due to the nature of the visit to NYC - a family member in the hospital. We needed a place close, within walking distance of the hospital with reasonably priced parking available. This hotel fit the bill and then some! They provided a tasty breakfast in their dining room every morning. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They helped make a difficult trip as pleasant as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: vacation112010
Reviews.Content: Our room with double queen size beds was very nice and clean (and yes, we looked for bugs, but none at all). We were on the 11th floor. The elevator was a little slow, but it was perfectly fine. The beds were more than comfortable; I slept like a baby. The room was equipped with hair dryer, microwave, small refrigerator, iron, ironing board, and a safe. The flat screen television was a real plus, as was free Wi-fi. We were driving a vehicle, so we were directed to the parking garage which was 1-1/2 blocks away. Although we were told parking was $20, we ended up paying $30 because we were driving a pick-up truck. The location was very convenient. We walked everywhere, including Times Square. We will definitely stay at the Ramada Inn Eastside again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms with no frills”
Reviews.Author: quesaxa
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the size and condition of our double queen room, it exceeded our expectations. Three blocks to Subway. Lobby and elevator is tiny, staff is a bit aloof but helpful, basic continental breakfast is included. You will not have any frills at all, but it was a terrific value and I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “This hotel certainly does not add any pleasure to your trip”
Reviews.Author: gsh_1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights. Positives: - OK location with Subway three blocks away and nice Indian restaurants in the neighborhood. - Free Wireless - Price OK Negatives: - Skip the breakfast, loveless buffet - Small room - Reception desk service OK but again: lacking the extra bit of effort. - No nice lobby to wait - No doorman for taxi service - Incredibly slow elevator

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: pemtca
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Ramada Eastside for five nights. Room & bathroom were both spotlessly clean, location convenient, choice of two subway stations closeby (28th st. & 32nd st.). Room was large by NYC standards (2 queens), but bathroom was small. Most staff very polite & helpful. Free continental breakfast between 6.30a.m & 10a.m. - bagels, toast, fruit, yoghurt, waffles, cereal, cream cheese etc., breakfast room can get busy around 9a.m. Overall no frills, but an excellent budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable place in a nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: WBird66
Reviews.Content: I struggled hard to find an affordable place in this part of the east side. This was the best deal I could find except for really low end places, and I was not disappointed. The room was very small, and bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen, but it was very clean and the bed was super-comfortable. Everything worked, and they had free wifi. The only complaint was that there was absolutely no concept of service. The check-in clerk not only did not welcome us warmly, she barely looked me in the eye. My husband was off parking the car, so I asked the desk clerk if someone could help me with the bags. She shouted at someone who was talking to other people and ignored us for a while. Finally he came over and took my bags, again without saying anything to me or acknowledging me. So stay there for a comfortable room in a good part of town, but don't expect any kind of service.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel when you just need a place to crash in midtown!”
Reviews.Author: rsqneo
Reviews.Content: The location is great, low 30's east side, subway a few blocks away. Small but modern and clean lobby. Rooms are basic, clean, but small. Don't expect more than a place to sleep with a TV and a small bathroom. But if you are staying in the city, that is all you need.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money in a Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: Awful_Kgp
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location approx 5-7 minutes walking distance from the nearest underground stations and had a number of Indian / Pakistani restaurants nearby serving Halal food at very economical prices which was a much needed advantage. Manhattan attractions were close by and the Penn station was a few dollars cab ride ( < 10 ) Room was large enough to accommodate us ( 2 adults and 3 children aged 7, 13, 12 ) so it was a economical and nice stay ! Breakfast though not great was satisfactory !

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service ever!”
Reviews.Author: epbhca
Reviews.Content: Arrived on redeye at 6 am on Sunday from LA. Booked the room with arrival day of Saturday because needed to get rest before a busy Sunday night in the city. Called in ahead and requested late check in, specified that will be there around 6 am. When we arrived, at 6 am, the room was not ready and the attendant, Paya, I believe was her name, said we have to wait 30 min. What?! Why?! It should have been ready yesterday at 3 pm. The woman had no explanation. She was very rude and unprofessional with no tact or customer service skills. By far the worst treatment I have ever gotten from anyone. When I told her this she calmly said - go complain to the manager. People like her have no business in customer service. She ruined our whole experience at Ramada. We ended up waiting a lot longer than 30 min for a room that we paid for since 3 pm the day before. Unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: laurettegzb
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommand highly this hotel, it is not refered in the french touristic guides, but so much better and cheaper that the others hotels referred! (between 125 et 170Â§) The room is enough big, absolutely comfortable and clean, with anything you would need, air conditionning, air dryer, iron, tv, safe, etc....(except a fridge). Free business center and breakfast included. The receptionist (Harry) is a very nice men, always available and pleased to provide help and advice. This hotel is located in mid-town, anything is available around, and the borough is fantastic as a base to discover Manhattan. You will enjoy your stay there like I did !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, great service”
Reviews.Author: aliandjulian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for the budget-minded traveller. The rooms are on the small side (but when are they not in NYC) but they are clean and comfortable. Breakfast included is a definite ++ assuming you are content with a no-frills one. Getting parking at only $20/day and free internet makes the room rate very appealing. I left my ipod in the docking station and housekeeping kept it. When I called, the manager confirmed that they had found it and that I could arrange for pick-up. I don't think that you could trust every hotel/cleaning staff to return an ipod. Very honest and service-oriented. Much appreciated!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs beware"”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler508
Reviews.Content: Now I know why the rates at this hotel are less than other NYC Hotels. During my stay last week I was bitten hundreds of times on my leg and lower back from what I found out later was bed bugs. In researching this hotel after my stay I found out that this hotel has a history of bed bug problems. I wouldn't stay at this hotel if the room was free!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a budget traveler--clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: English10a
Reviews.Content: My small, but totally acceptable non-smoking room with one double bed was modern, clean, pleasant, had a window with a view of someone else's rooftop garden, and after the AAA discount was about $150 a night--a true bargain in NYC. The small bathroom was newly renovated and fine for one person. Murray Hill is a nice location. There is no real lobby or restaurant/bar in the hotel, but there are plenty of restaurants close enough. There is a simple free breakfast in a room downstairs. Front desk service was not exactly outgoing, but there was nothing to complain about. I would recommend this for anyone who wants to spend their money on doing things in the city and not on a hotel room. AND there's free internet in the rooms--a very welcome amenity!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoanneOS
Reviews.Content: We stayed last year and am only writing a review now! Its a good hotel from the point of view of price, location. If it was an extra special trip, it would be worth spending more (we booked early and got a good rate). Overall we were happy with it. Excellent value when you consider its New York!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vouso
Reviews.Content: It's from 20 to 30 minutes walking from the hotel to Times Square. Budget Hotel, no fridge in the room and no laundry machines, but you and find one two blocks away. Close to several eating places and delis.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but price on the high side”
Reviews.Author: ginmi1976
Reviews.Content: In general, I enjoyed my stay at the Ramada. It's in a great location and close to everything. The hotel is well maintained and it seems like management is very good at running a tight ship. Be aware though that the rooms are quite small unless you travel alone. If there is two of you and you also do some shopping, then you will struggle to fit it all in your hotel room. The Internet was also down for an entire day while we were here but I guess that is beyond the hotel's control. Overall, a good place to stay if you don't mind a small room and...the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “They are crooks-do not use their telephone, it is a trap”
Reviews.Author: zamaSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: On arrival I was told I can buy calling card that I can use in my room, but to my surprise the reception lady reserved a $114 more than the amount quoted in the website for my 6 day stay. I knew this immediately because I have an in-contact sms service linked to my credit card. On checking out I was told that the calling card never worked therefore all my calls went through their system and I was charged huge amounts (which added up to this $114) off which I find very convenient. They are certainly not honest, and by the looks of things they will do anything to rob you-- so be warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sfb18
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised! Though the rooms were small, the hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. It was good value, especially considering that a modest breakfast was included. We'd stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: aggieamy5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Eastside on July 2 to 8, 2010. We booked two hotel rooms since we were traveling in a group. The hotel is close to Midtown and is only about a 5 minute walk to the closest subway line. We arrived at the hotel around 3 pm (which is check-in time), but one of the rooms was not quite ready. The front desk staff was very helpful and nice and said they could put us in a similar room without a fridge and microwave (the rooms are the same price), but we decided to wait for the nicer room. Also we requested for our two rooms to be on the same floor at the time of booking, but the front desk was unable to accommodate our request. This was not a big deal for us at all. So we all went up to the room that was available, and the front desk called us approximately 20 minutes later to say that other room was ready. The rooms were pretty nice for the price. They were fairly spacious with the usual amenities that any other hotel room would have. There was little counter space on the bathroom sink, but we were able to manage okay. Also, as many other reviewers have pointed out, the door to the bathroom is frosted glass and we could definitely see through it. I cannot imagine why anyone would want a bathroom door with a glass panel! One nice thing about the Ramada Eastside is that they offer a free continental breakfast each morning. This consisted of quite a few items such as bagels, a variety of donuts, fruit, cereals, yogurt, etc. I thought this was a very nice amenity for a New York hotel. The only true complaint I really have about this hotel is the lack of air conditioning in the elevators and hallways. We were there in the middle of summer in 100 degree weather and thought this was rather odd. Also, when housekeeping cleaned our room they would often turn off the air to our room, causing us to come home to a VERY hot and stuffy room after a long day of sightseeing. This seemed liked an absurd thing to do in the middle of summer! I guess this is the hotelâ€™s way of cutting costs and saving money, but it annoyed us. Overall, we had a good stay at the Ramada Eastside and would probably stay there again. I did tons of research on hotels before we left and this was one of the best hotels I could find for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good! Very good value and location. RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: Fabio_NY
Reviews.Content: Dear Trip-Advisor visitors/members, After the ugly experience in my previous staying in New York at Jolly (which I have also rated) I was looking for a better experience, to really enjoy my staying in NY. Room was larger then the ones provided by the last two hotels I stayed in, even though previous hotels were supposed to be better, seeing the prices and prestigious names. Location is perfect (Lexington Avenue!). Hotel is clean, Staff is perfect, desk personnel tries always to accommodate your needs. Internet has been provided free of charge. Great Value of Money. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay again at Ramada Eastside next time I travel to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist-friendly and convenently located”
Reviews.Author: otavio_silveira
Reviews.Content: Located on mid-Manhattan, the hotel is not big but feature many amenities that bigger hotels do not offer, such as complimentary continental breakfast (although the breakfast room gets crowded later in the morning) and free wireless internet access. Hotel staff is very friendly and rooms are well-equipped and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpectedly pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: jf329
Reviews.Content: Booked here due to a good rate for NYC. Ended up enjoying the experience nicely. Very clean, nicely decorated room. Good free continental breakfast (although the basement room isn't so special). Staff was mildly pleasant, but you don't really need to interact with them anyway. Great location for the price. Not a fan of the Tempur-Pedic bed, but it was OK. Best of all - free wireless internet!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: sibonator
Reviews.Content: 8 nights on this hotel, and absolutely nothing to complain about. The room was nice and clean, although a bit tiny, but hey who cares. Breakfast was a treat as i enjoyed my daily Fruit Loops, donut and bagel. Would recommend this to everyone who needs a decent hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than expected. A economical gem.”
Reviews.Author: CyberEdge
Reviews.Content: We took a reservation here because it was cheap ($160 on-line) but would have stayed longer if we could. the place was roomier than expected, newly remodeled, and very clean. The location (30th and Lexington) is super convenient, too. Not only that, but free WiFi and breakfast is included! We (my wife and I) thought this was an exceptional value for New York City and will certainly stay hear again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find - GREAT bed - quiet neighbourhood - VERY clean”
Reviews.Author: Sharon128
Reviews.Content: My 21-year old daughter and I just came back from a great trip to NYC. This hotel, although not in the heart of the action of Times Square, is only a 5-10 minute walk to the subway and about a 25-30 minute walk to Times Square. After walking all day, we looked forward to coming back to the most comfortable bed we have EVER slept in. The neighbourhood is nice and quiet. The hotel is very clean and the staff was very nice. Our room was a decent size and again the bed was incredibly comfortable. Our room and bathroom were very clean and the shower was great! The door to the bathroom was quite soundproof. The continental breakfast consisted of coffee/tea, juices, bagels, donuts, cereals, yogurt, waffles/pancakes, fresh fruits - great to start off the day. We shared a shuttle van from Newark right to our hotel for $17 each (Go Airlink NYC) and $18 each from our hotel doors back to the airport. The elevators are a bit slow, but who cares - we were not in a rush! We got a decent on-line booking rate, and would both definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location in NYC? You bet!”
Reviews.Author: skeeterplustbone
Reviews.Content: Great location in quiet Murray Hill neighborhood- 5 min walk to Empire State, Macy's. Lots of restaurants nearby. Helpful staff. Large room- very surprising for NYC- clean, continental breakfast was decent but breakfast room gets very crowded. I would recommend this hotel to friends,family and stay here again- good value

Reviews.Title: “Urine Stain Alert!!!”
Reviews.Author: Threesisters2010
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews of the hotel, we decided to stay here for the convenient location and it's features shown on-line. We were met by Harry, the front deskman. He was pleasant but the customer service is nothing to write home about. After a long day of sightseeing, we were ready for a good night's rest. Normally, one would just open the top cover of the bed; then proceed to use the blanket-sheet covers underneath. Luckily that night, I opened up the blanket then proceeded to examine the sheet underneath. To my surprise, there was a HUGE urine stain on the bottom corner of the bed. Now, if you were to open the sheets mid way, you would not see the stain. We were disgusted and my children refused to sleep on the bed. Called the front desk, they came with new sheets. I discussed the matter with the GM the following day and it seems as though their reaction to the matter was "just another day." His accommodation for us was not that I expected and I voiced my dissatisfaction over the matter openly. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: TouringOnion
Reviews.Content: On arrival from out of country we were met by a 'not too friendly Front Desk agent ' who matter of factly informed us my credit card had declined and they didn't have a room for us ! Great !! I booked the room a month earlier on Ramada.com AND got Confirmation a month earlier. Apparently they don't contact you to let you know !!. I asked to speak to GM who really didn't want to speak face to face but eventually did. He 'managed' to provide us with two doubles rather than the double queen we had booked and of course..... we had to pay in full for the second room. Give him his due, the GM gave us the two rooms at the Advance Purchase Price ( x2) we had 'booked'. Then steps in Harry - a very helpful Front Desk agent who I was able to work with and who found us our desired room after 4 nights . To finish this part of the story .... Ramada - their service lacks ( at best). I called to complain and you are told how its your responsibility to make sure there are funds for credit card ( actually there were !) and no offer of apology that you were 'inconvenienced'. When I suggested that they might try to contact you in event your credit card has a problem since they have tel # , e-mail etc , I was told that they don't - " it's your responsibility to ....." - I guess you are supposed to check everything . When the agent from Ramada keeps telling you how much they care.... well - doesn't seem like it to me. So , to the hotel itself .... 1) location - great - the sole reason we chose it 2) breakfast - not much to write about in fact we had bfast elsewhere several times 3) Front Desk - variable in terms of service and friendliness. 4) Rooms - doubles are small ( Queen was spacious with refrig) 5) Noisy - no 6) Clean - Yes 7) Would I stay again - maybe, but I'd certainly not go thru' Ramada Reservations. I've never done it but get sense that if you dare try to get room on the cheap they will treat you as if .... " you've tried to save a buck and wanted a room on cheap" - as it was it cost me dearly over the rate I should have paid.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get the room we paid extra for”
Reviews.Author: RyanMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel room online. On the website, we chose and paid a good bit extra for a room with a king bed. However, the actual reservation confirmation email said "large room". We didn't notice, and when we got there, they stuck us in a tiny room with a tiny bed. If "large room" means about 12" on each side of the bed, I'd like to know what the small rooms look like. They were unwilling to resolve the problem. Aside from this, the hotel was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Am I dreaming?”
Reviews.Author: aiodice737
Reviews.Content: Great hotel value and service. Super clean room at a non NYC rate. Free breakfast in the morning. Rooms are small but execptionaly clean and just re-modeled. Tempur-pedic beds(great). Good location between downtown and midtown. Have stayed here bi monthly for over a year now.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: theroad2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week - a work/pleasure combo trip. We had a few long work days and then attempted to see as much of the city as we could so it was important to us to get a good nights sleep and we did.
