We were on the 12th floor and couldn't hear any noise from our neighbors and not much from the street below. The room we were in was small but accommodated our luggage and equipment - a bit of a do it yourself place in terms of luggage. The location is good with a terrific little breakfast place two doors south. Subways a couple blocks away. Everyone was very nice, but especially Harry who saw to it that we could check out late and arranged for a car to the airport. Good price for a good place. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: EnglishmanNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ramada Inn Eastside for 3 nights between 13th and 16th March 2010. Very clean and comfortable, quiet at nights, nice room with coffee/tea maker, ironing board and iron and large TV. Continental breakfast was very good, staff were helpful and it was in a great location. A great value hotel for a first time visitor to New York. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay for Price”
Reviews.Author: SweetbriarManor
Reviews.Content: Stayed a single Saturday night and the hotel was first rate. Checked in early (11AM) not expecting the room to be ready and we would just store our bags but our room was available. Room size was more then adequate for our purposes, a home base for the over night trip. Room was very clear with no evidence of past guests. Bed was very comfortable and the neighborhood very quiet over night. The hotel is three blocks from the Lexington Subway line under Park Avenue with stops at either 28 or 33rd Street with the hotel at 30th Street and Lexington. The nightly room rate for the service provided at a midtown Manhattan Island hotel couldnâ€™t be beat and we intend to stay again next time we travel to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seun_10
Reviews.Content: Can't complain.Stayed 3 nights with my wife in November.Courteous staff.Room cleaned daily (the cleaning lady was fab).The free complimentary breakfast came in handy.Free wifi and free phone calls within the US (landlines and mobile).Free access to the business centre.Good location within walking distance of most Manhattan attractions.They also helped arrange a shuttle back to the airport on departure (far cheaper than calling a cab).Will surely recommend this place to anyone needing a nice but cheap hotel to stay in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent midtown location, tolorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Young707
Reviews.Content: Booked on hotel web site in August. Stayed at this hotel in October for a week. Midtown, 3 blocks from 28th & Park Avenue MTA #6 Green Line station. Fantastic location. Old refurbished 12 story brown stone. Toilet backup twice. Called Front desk. Housekeeper came promptly with plunger. Done. Small room, sigh â€“ thatâ€™s Manhattan. Queen size bed, small, two adults - squeeze. Excellent Tempur-Pedic mattress, very impressive. Bed frame and box spring squeaks every time we moved, very annoying. Choose room facing 30th Street side instead of facing Lexington Avenue. Quieter with less traffic; no view, but who care. Mini bath tub, sigh again. The rooms facing inside courtyard are the most quiet; but those are larger rooms with two queen beds. Free WiFi internet access, slow but adequate; speed test 293kbps at 8am in the morning. Free breakfast, good. Free telephone call anywhere within USA, incredible. Air Conditioner effective cool the room quick, but may be too noisy to sleep while the AC was on. Requested housekeeping for extra blanket and bed sheet; delivered promptly. No refrigerator, No microwave, sign request no food in room. Numerous restaurants and grocery within a block or two. We tried several better restaurants along 3rd Avenue. 32â€� LCD TV, with HBO movie channels, but video is NTSC analog 320x240 lowest fussy resolutions, what a shame. Clock is LCD without backlight and cannot be seen in the dark. Bathroom glass is unusual; particularly the bathroom light brightness would probably awaken another person sleeping in the room. One night, there was no water. Next morning (the most expensive day of over $250 compare the rest of the week), the faucet water came out dark brown with smell. The hotel management was not smart enough to immediately deliver bottle to every guest, or did not care. Of course, they do know how to charge us the room in full. They said the city was working on water up the street. However, we, as guest had to go up the street and buy bottle water ourselves. At check out, we were bill Sales Tax $15.57+ City Tax 10.31 + Javits Fee $1.50 + Occupancy Tax $2.00 every day. That is over 15% of the room charge, not shown in ramada.com when we booked the room. So beware, you cannot compare ramada.com reservation room charge with all other online booking reservation sites which always show total cost, including tax.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, decent location, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: JoshLNC
Reviews.Content: After searching for hours online, I am very satisfied to have found this hotel. Travelling with our two teenage children, having two queen size beds was a deal breaker. The desk staff was exceptionally friendly and I felt like the hotel was run by a warm family. Parking is just two blocks away (be sure to get your ticket stamped at the hotel). As I write this, I'm sitting in the room which is small yet appears to have been remodeled recently. I'm looking at tasteful artwork on the walls, a nice flat screen tv, crown molding along the ceiling and attractive lighting fixtures. The bathroom has great water pressure and a nice shower and showerhead. I wish the bathroom had an air vent and the door did not have partially frosted glass for greater privacy. The breakfast buffet was your basic continental variety. When we first arrived there was not much food, but after about 10 minutes the staff came to replenish. I wish we had cold water at the buffet to complement the juices, milk and coffee. We wanted to check in early and check out late, but because we were unable to do so, we stored our belongings in the locked luggage area with the very helpful assistance of one of the staff members. This was a great value and I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Big improvements, great value.”
Reviews.Author: blzjames
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at this Ramada back in the late 90's and early 2000s because it was cheap, but it was nothing special. Well, much to my surprise, I stayed there on a budget trip to NY a couple weeks ago, and the place is still inexpensive, but COMPLETELY remodeled. The bed was amazing, the wireless free, the staff helpful and the entire experience was amazing. Close to the train, wine bar, great restaurants... I will stay her again, often, even when I can afford something more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Comfortable, Convenient & Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: LuxValueSeeker
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of this particular chain of hotels having experienced some dumps around the country associated with this brand. The Ramada Eastside is the exception. First of all, the staff is awesome! A special thank you to Julie at the Front Desk, the woman put up with a lot yet managed to stay cheerful through her shift. The housekeeping gentlemen was always quick to deliver toiletries, towels and what nots when needed and I swear I think he lives there :) I was there for a week so I got to witness their professionalism for quite some time. Second, the room is compact but nicely appointed...and the bed put me into a deep, dreamy slumber every night. Only thing I did not like was that the chair kept on hitting the bed due to the small space between it and the desk (note to hotel: you may want to re-arrange that work space area a bit). Other than this little annoyance, it was a great experience and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracim
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed there for a 2 night stay. Our son is in the hospital and it is a very short walk to the hospital. The hotel was extremely clean and the room, though small, fit our needs. Staff is very pleasant and helpful. Continental breakfast was what you would expect. We are booked to return this weekend and the following and will continue to use this hotel for as long as we need to keep returning to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not even close to "good enough".”
Reviews.Author: mfandre
Reviews.Content: The room is tiny, but clean. The breakfast is crap. Except for the cleaning lady, and the guy at front desk, the staff is a shame. If you are just looking for the best price, in a really nice location, go for it. But don't expect to be treated like a king.

Reviews.Title: “the bed felt like home”
Reviews.Author: crown2511
Reviews.Content: I sta;yed there two nights just this past week and I have to say that the bed was very comfortable, its a tempurpedic (which is what I have at home) and I slept in so late on the day I was leaving I missed doing more sightseeing. The staff was wonderful, rooms very clean, the breakfast was good and I believe her name is Rita that works in the breakfast room is wonderful. Very good value! If I ever go back to NY I will definately stay there again. Just a note you can buy your tour tickets there also and save yourself a trip downtown. They will also arrange for transportation to and from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, but unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: BobbyFrings
Reviews.Content: The location is good and the price is one of the cheapest in NYC, but the rooms are small and unremarkable, need rennovating and the service is sub-par. I've stayed at this hotel on three different occasions and have generally been disappointed, but for what hotels go for these days in NYC, it's worth the price. Once the heating in my room didn't work in the middle of winter, the other time my room was right next to the ice maker (bad luck I guess), but I keep coming back because where else can you find an affordably priced hotel in NYC, and twice I was generally satisfied by my room. Don't expect a gem (some of these reviews are terribly overrated) but you won't feel totally ripped off either.

Reviews.Title: “Fine experience”
Reviews.Author: Danac106
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom were spotlessly clean, evidently newly decorated. Room was small, but it had two chairs, two bedside tables, LED reading lamps (besides the regular bedside lights), a desk, and three drawer bureau, flat screen TV. Staff was helpful. Housekeeping excellent. There is a complimentary breakfast, the usual toast, bagels, cereal...but there was also yogurt and fruit. We would certainly return. Ten minutes walk to 28th St. Lexington Avenue subway stop, which is not at all bad. We did not have a car, but we noticed that they were offering a reduced rate parking fee of about $20 for 24 hours, which is fantastic for midtown Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “If you like curry, this is the place for you; if not, stay soemwhere else”
Reviews.Author: sologuy
Reviews.Content: I did not realize that Murrray Hill was Little India. Everything in this hotel, including the bedclothes, reaks of curry. I am very sensitive to odours and had to check out after 1 night of a 4 day stay. The room, otherwise was 'clean'. There is a window in the bathroom door and a window in the bathroom. This combination, although covered with a thin plastic film, allows too much light into the room, don't expect to sleep past first light of day, but at least you won't need an alarm clock. Great location 2 blocks from subway and walking distance to shopping dsitrict, but you have to be able to tolerate the above. I thought I was getting value for money, but once again, you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewportWelshmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights during September. Room was a nice size (king size bed) and was modern.Large tv ,good quality furniture and good shower. Two lifts for the 12 floors.Complimentary breakfast was excellent,( toast,juice,coffee,boiled eggs,waffles,pancakes,cereal,fruit and more).Secure luggage room if required.Not in an attractive area but most of New York hotels are no different. 10 minute walk to Empire State Building.Times Square about a 30-40 min walk.Large selection of restaurants / shops nearby. Subway station 5 min walk. Safe in room (free).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a very good value”
Reviews.Author: TheUglyAmerican
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ramada Eastside for one night recently and were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and recently remodeled rooms available at a moderate price. Be advised that single bed rooms are SMALL but efficient. Double bed rooms are quite a bit larger, even spacious. The free breakfast was great and plentiful, with items constantly being replenished. The front desk help was pleasant and helpful. This hotel is conveniently located near Murray Hill, Herald Square, the Empire State Building etc. AAA discount is available but make sure you bring your card.

Reviews.Title: “The location is great! Service is good..”
Reviews.Author: AJtheTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, it was really clean but the room and the bathroom were small. It is really convenient, 10 min. away from Empire State by Walking, and 5-10 min. walk to the subway (to go to Time Square, Central Park, etc.) It was also the cheapest one we have found in downtown. Staff were friendly. But in the end they sold us a shuttle which will take us from the hotel to the LaGuardia Airport, they made us pay 40 bucks, but then we have realized that if we had had the taxi instead, we could have paid only 25 bucks. :/ The breakfast is really basic, but satisfactory. Besides there is a Brazilian Coffee Shop Just adjacent to the hotel.. Awesome! I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: WNPK
Reviews.Content: My husband, my father-in-law, and a friend of ours stayed at the Ramada Eastside from 8/9-8/13. This is a really good hotel to stay at when in New York, and hopefully my review of the most important things below will help anyone looking for a decently-priced hotel make a good decision. When I was looking at hotels, I really needed the place we stayed to have good amenities, medium-to-large sized rooms, be accessible to the subways, have internet access and have some kind of breakfast. In essence, I was looking for a mid-range hotel with thoughtful amenities. The Apple Core Hotel chain fit the bill for me and my family quite well. Pricing The prices are reasonable, ranging from $109/single person/queen sized bed/night to anywhere around $200. I kept watching their rates online, and was able to get the lowest prices. They offer a 10% AAA discount if you show your card when you check in. In NY, that was a great price, especially for how spacious the rooms are. Rooms We all had rooms with queen-sized beds. The rooms have been renovated over the last 6 months, and are contemporary in design (sage green, dark brown, oatmeal colors). There is enough room to walk around, and because of the high ceilings, you won't feel boxed in or claustorphobic. You won't have a ton of space, as this is NY, but you won't be cramped either. The beds are Tempur-pedic mattresses (aka memory foam), and comfortable. The linens are nice cotton, and while there aren't luxurious duvet covers, the blankets were warm. The fairly new pillows are standard foam ones. The room had a full bathroom, even though it was small, with a shower, tub, sink, toilet and hair dryer. There is plenty of drawer space, if you need to unpack for a longer trip (2 nightstands and a chest of 4 drawers). The closet was small, but there was an in-room safe, an iron and ironing board and luggage rack, so we had everything we needed. The rooms also had nice new flat screen TVs. The air conditioner worked great...we didn't need the heater as it was hot as hell in NYC...and the large window in the room gave a lot of light. Thankfully, there are blackout curtains! There was a desk and coffee maker in the room, too. Amenities We really liked the free WiFi and business center in the hotel. The Wifi is not super fast, and is shared by all guests in the hotel, so there are times when it will be really slow. Also, there aren't any ethernet ports in the rooms so you won't have the option of plugin in a cable. We were able to get email, but couldn't really watch the news or shows online on Amazon Video-on-Demand because the internet wasn't fast enough. There were plenty of brochures and maps for things to do in NY, if you need them, at the reception. The continental breakfast was basic, but good enough with mostly juices, milk, cereals, bagels, breads, English muffins, coffee, tea and boiled eggs. The breakfast items do run out by the last 1/2 hour of the breakfast time, so make sure to get there with enough time. If you miss it, there is the Brasil Coffee Shop attached to the hotel, where you can get a bigger variety of food. There is a fitness center, which we didn't use, and vending machines on the ground floor, that run out if the hotel is busy. The hotel also has a baggage check, so you can leave your luggage in their storeroom after you check out. Staff The staff was friendly at the hotel. Our best experiences were with Priya and Harry, but everyone was nice. The housekeeping folks are cool and do a great job. Neighborhood Murray Hill is a quieter part of NY. We didn't want to stay in the heart of Times Square, so this worked out to be a great location. We didn't hear the sirens or cabbies or crowds at night like you would in other parts of the city. Getting to the 4,5,6 subway lines was easy, as the 28th St & 34th St. stations are equidistance away, about 4 blocks. The neighborhood has some great Italian and Indian restaurants that are open late, and most of them can be found on 3rd Avenue or Lexington. Chinese Mirch, Lannam Vietnamese, and Turkish Kitchen were our favorites! Things to Know Overall, our stay at the hotel was really good. There are two quirks that I think anyone staying there should know about. One, there are two small elevators for the entire hotel. Guests and maintenance / housekeeping all use the same elevators. It can get pretty crazy around breakfast and check-out time in the morning, so plan for a wait. Also, ice machines are only on the 6th and 9th floors. If you get a room on either of those floors, definitely request ones away from them, as all guests who want ice at the hotel will come up there to get it, and you'll hear the ice machine working all night. Along with these quirks, there is one warning that I would give guests, simply because we experienced this. When you make your reservation, make sure that the credit card you will charge the room to is valid and is not in jeopardy of expiring. Our card expired -- which is obviously not the hotel's fault -- but because they authorize the charge for the first night of your stay to your card even before you arrive, you will need it to be valid. Since our's wasn't, the hotel didn't hold a room for us, and we didn't have a place to stay on 8/8 like we thought we did. We had a room booked for myself and my husband one night before the rest of our family joined us, and we felt like the hotel should have called us, since we'd booked multiple other rooms. We were in a bind since we didn't find out until we got there in the evening, after having flown from Los Angeles. We could have given them another credit card, no problem, but they had given our room away. Priya, who was on duty at the front desk, was helpful in trying to get us another room in the city, and she let us keep our bags in their bag check, but that was a hassle we didn't need that first evening. It could have been avoided very easily by a phone call. Luckily we found a place to stay, and everything worked out, but it was more expensive that we had budgeted for. So...word of warning, just be careful. Again, our stay was extremely comfortable and we would definitely stay again for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: llbb2121
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with our stay at this hotel. The rooms were updated and very clean. Check in and out effortless. Helpful staff. Free internet and breakfast were a bonus. Location easy to get to all areas of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A few disappointments...”
Reviews.Author: Vovelle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a neighborhood that one could describe as Little India. There are a lot of nice Indian restaurants around (many of them completely vegetarian). We also tried many other types of restaurants nearby and were never disappointed. The hotel is on the green line of the subway (#6), which services a lot of museums and other tourist hotspots. Just walk around in all directions to get to know the neighborhood and you will eventually find what you are looking for. Free wireless that worked. The price was right. Now the bad side... I chose the hotel based on the reviews posted on the Trip Advisor website (the one with the mouse and the other with the cockroach were not posted then, otherwise I would not have booked with them!!!). Although efficient, the front desk staff are most unfriendly. They never greet you when you enter or exit the hotel. They just stare at you. We had a very small hotel room -- not ideal for working if you are there on business (a small desk was placed right next to the TV). There was a queen bed with very little space around for two people. It seemed quite clean, although I had an allergy to either the cleaning products or something else in the room. (Another guest was scratching uncontrollably in the elevator.) On some cleaning days, our room was cleaned to perfection. On others, they dropped clean towels and supplies in the bathroom, and did not bother doing the bed! We were there for ten days, and although I do not like wasting water on cleaning sheets excessively, I knew for sure that they did not change them until day 8 because I cut myself accidentally and got a blood spot on the sheets, which was there for an eternity! The bathroom smelled of pee when we got there, and the smell never disappeared. I don't think they clean the bathroom floors with disinfectant. For four days straight, our bathroom floor was never cleaned (the same hair was there -- and when it's so small, believe me, you notice). The remote control did not work. My husband went to the front desk to request new batteries. They sent the audio guy upstairs who showed up, I think, with the same remote. It worked while he tried it, and then it did not work again. I did not bother with it again. They encourage people to post good reviews on Trip Advisor, which I do not like very much. They should worry more about getting a supervisor to check the cleanliness of the rooms and about dealing with pest control. I did hear some suspicious noise one night. I will definitely not return, although I liked the location. The size of the room was not a big concern -- I was not expecting the Plaza for the price I paid --, but I do not tolerate uncleanliness and unwanted visitors.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: k8_raleigh
Reviews.Content: My friend and I met up in NYC for a girls' weekend getaway. Initially, we were impressed by the size and cleanliness of the room. For an older building, it seemed to be quite well maintained and it was obvious that the rooms had been modernized. Still, it was nothing fancy but quite nice for the price. However, on our first evening, my friend found a cockroach in our coffee maker. Fortunately, we only saw and killed the one but where there's one cockroach, there are always many more. That was off-putting enough for us to keep all of our belongings zipped up in our suitcases for our entire stay. There was also a strange incident with some towels that were hanging in our closet. They were damp and left on hangers. Not sure why they were there, we left the closet door open one day so that the housekeeping staff would see the towels and change or remove them. However, the towels stayed there for our entire visit. The staff was competent. There weren't overly friendly or helpful but they weren't rude or unhelpful either. They served their function, nothing more or less and that was just fine with us. One slight annoyance with our check-out though. We contacted the front desk at approximately 11:15am (45 minutes before our departure) and asked them to call an airport limousine to pick us up at noon. Five minutes after our request, the front desk called our room and told us that our car had arrived, and to please come downstairs. It was a minor incident but irritating because we had to rush to finish packing and check ou of the hotel. On the plus side, we had booked a smoking room but were hoping that we could get a non-smoking room. The hotel wasn't able to accomodate us but the smoking room was was very clean and did not smell of smoke at all. If we didn't know that we were given a smoking room, we would not have been able to tell. Also, the beds were very comfortable. All in all, it was not the most enjoyable stay but it was by no means the worst. This hotel cost approximately $30/night less than any other hotel we could find of a comparable class/rating. We had originally reserved a room in another hotel which was brand new and I'm sure that we wouldn't have had the bug issues in the new hotel, but we decided to save a little money and go with this hotel. The problems weren't enough to put a damper on our visit, but it would have been much nicer to have a bug-free stay. It's an old building and I know there's only so much that one can really do to completely eliminate a cockroach infestation. This may be the reason why this hotel is available for a lower price than their competitors. We got exactly what we paid for. You need to consider your comfort level with cockroaches before booking with this hotel. If you're ok with them, then this hotel is a very good value. If they tend to gross you out, then it's worth the investment to book a more expensive hotel. Personally, I probably won't stay at this hotel again because of the cockroach issue. I understand the difficulties of dealing with cockroaches, but that doesn't mean I'm ok with sleeping with them.

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN GEM!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChIcon
Reviews.Content: this is such a great place...i don't think i/you should tell anyone!!! i wound up seeing many of the other hotels i checked while planning this trip - on the shuttle from laguardia (along lexington)!! even my driver made a good comment when he dropped me off!! the room i was in was perfect for me!! this place is on the no-frills side (no room service, you don't get escorted to your room upon check-in). one of my only real complaints would have to be about some of the staff!!! i needed to print my boarding pass for my flight, once i located the business center i went to print and there was no paper in the printer!!! i picked up the phone which automatically began to ring an extension, i told the person on the other end what i was calling about and was told to come back up to the front desk to get some!!! once upstairs i was handed about a half ream, I DON'T WORK HERE, i took the 4 sheets that i was going to need and finished my print job!!! one caution for families with small children...i noticed many doors left open leading to ominous looking fire escapes!! the room i was in (404) had been recently upgraded!!! although it was a smoking room...it did not smell of cigarettes past @ all!!! two suggestions that i would have for the hotel itself...the constant door slamming from other guest rooms is very jarring...not to mention that it makes it very difficult to sleep in!!! especially around the time that the housekeepers are making their rounds!!! the other suggestion would be to clean the windows!!! it has been very rainy in the city this summer - i get that - but there was a layer/film of dirt that looked like it had been there for a while!!! the room and the hotel were very well maintained!!! the restaurant next door looked very inviting!!! the train (6) is only 2 blocks away...very convenient!!! there are many things open late night and 24/7 around 28th/park which is where the entrances are (mcdonalds, duane reade). murray hill is not the center of the city - the in place to be - but it is centrally located to pretty much everything!! i will definitely make this the first place i check on my next trip to nyc!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute value for money by New York standards.”
Reviews.Author: stranger371
Reviews.Content: It is a very clean and well managed hotel, with nice rooms, breakfast and wifi included in all the rooms at no extra cost. Some people may find the rooms too small, but by New York standards they are not really small. All real estate in New York is small. I almost want to suggest the owners of this property to get away from Ramada franchise and list it under their own brand. Not all Ramada properties are in good condition. Another suggestion I have for the property owners "Apple Core" is that they should indicate on their website about the AAA discount they offer on all their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: citesear
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely pleased with this hotel. Was our 1st trip to NYC, You never know what you are going to get when you book a hotel, but the description listed was exactly what we got. Clean, great location, great staff and a bargain price.The bathroom is a very important to us and this was very clean and no mildew, breakfast bar was great, with a choice of 2 daily newspapers. The hotel is within walking distance of all major sites you want to visit, including the metro line. We will recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to spend a night or two in NYC. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LSuther2771
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely thrilled with this hotel. You never know what you are going to get when you book a NYC hotel, but the description listed was exactly what we got. Clean, roomy, great location, great staff and a bargain price. We will stay there again! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, close to restaurants and subway”
Reviews.Author: Design_9
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great place to stay considering the other times I stayed in New York was in Manhattan. This was indeed a hidden gem and it was great to stay in Murray Hill. There is a lot of interesting things to see and do in Murray Hill and it was great to see all these restaurants nearby the hotel. I enjoyed the continential breakfast and was pleased with the service there. I also enjoyed using the free internet in the Business Center. There was also a printer you could use to print out info. from the internet if you wanted to and it was also free ! The hotel room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: WBotelhoMPereira
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend chose this hotel after severals we found in the internet. We were looking for a quieter area but close to everything and affordable. Ramada Eastside did not disappointed our expectations. Clean, nice neighbourhood, recently refurbshided, excelent beds and with a fair complimentary coffe. Free wireless internet in the roon is a must. Staff is helpefull when needed. A nice coffe shop in the building always with lots of young people (it looked like they were students) with their lap tops and books. Although some reviews said elevators were slow we did not noticed that. We did our reservation by Ramada website and all went as it should be. Will came back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: oldtraveler2wong
Reviews.Content: Was in town for graduation and stayed for 9 days. Had a great stay. The staff was very professional, from the front desk, maid service and breakfast crew. The breakfast was continental and nothing to write home about, but it was fresh. Lots of casual restarants new by, esp those serving Indian foods. Subway was 2 blocks away. Grocery stores nearby if you want to have a picnic. This is the 3rd different Applecore I have stayed in and I enjoyed this one the most.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Pascaleh
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend to NYC for a 5 days vacation from May 14-19. I looked for a reasonably priced hotel and the reviews I had found online were promising. The Ramada Lexington is centrally located (30th and Lexington), and the price is quite reasonable for Manhattan. The hotel is located two blocks from Line 6 of the Subway (28th and Lexington), which is quite convenient. The room was a bit small, and the bed (advertised as a queen sized) was a bit on the small size. I didn't have a tape measure, however I would guess that it wasn't the standard 60". The bathroom was super tiny, with a bathtub made for a 7 years old, lol. The water pressure in the bathroom was great. The room also offers a flat screen TV (also with HBO), and a nice fridge. So it's a mini room, but very well organized, it also offers a large closet (I mean large for the size of the room, lol), where you can store your luggage.. Everything was clean and the staff quite helpful. For the price you also get a continental breakfast. The breakfast room is located on the lower level, which can seem a bit odd for some people. The breakfast offering is: toast, bagels, coffee, hot tea, fruits and cereals. And I think I saw some boiled eggs as well. There is no ice at all in the breakfast room, so if you like iced tea like I do, I would encourage you to get an ice bucket and stop on the 6th of the 9th floor to get some ice before going downstairs. The breakfast room is not very large, so you might want to go early as you might have to wait for a table. They serve breakfast from 6am to 10am, and it is quite crowded the last two hours. From the hotel, it takes a 5 minutes the Empire State Building, located on 34th and 5th. The front desk clerk arranged for a limo back toe JFK, for a flat rate of $50 instead of the $45 that Taxi charge, however you can be sure they are on time. There is also a gym on the first floor, with a few exercise machines. And of course, the hotel offers free wireless access. That was nice. And it worked all the time! For the price, I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value for money. Great place to stay in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: grenelle90
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ramada Eastside for 10 nights in early May, and have to say this is a really exceptional value-for-money hotel. I arrived at around 11pm and that was no problem (I let them know about it). The room was medium-sized, with a large flat TV screen and safe. The bathroom was really large for a hotel, with a bathtub and a big mirror. There were 9 towels (3 for each size), all of them replaced every day. It was all very clean. The safe didn't work, but was promptly fixed by the staff. The breakfast isn't anything special, but it's also free, so no complaints about it. The front-desk staff wasn't always so warm, but I didn't care that much. Moreover, they let me check-out two hours late. The location is very good: Midtown Manhattan, with a 5-minute walk from the subway. Liked best: value for money, room. Liked least: breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: CDGYYZ
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent find for Manhattan - the price was excellent and the hotel offered many many extras for free that you would pay for in other (more expensive) hotels. Free wifi, breakfast, use of computers and printers, check in kiosk for both the hotel and flights, in-room coffee maker etc... A small fridge would be nice but at this price, we're not complaining! The room was of a good size and the bathroom large and clean. We were on the 9th floor and even though we were on the corner of 30th and Lexington, the traffic noise was not a problem. The only complaints, if you could call them that, would be that there is no blind or curtain on the bathroom window (though the glass is frosted) and because the door to the bathroom was glass, the light from outside came into the bedroom. We fixed this the second night by having the closet door open to cover the glass door partially but a blind on the bathroom window would be useful. Secondly, it would be nice to see some more environmentally friendly table ware in the breakfast room - the cheap plastic cutlery and styrofoam plates were just a little cheap feeling and surely not good for the environment... All in all a fabulous experience - we will definitely be back and recommending to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A great NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: compare
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada 5/10-16/09 and found it to be an exceptional value for the price I paid. Breakfast was fresh and plenty of it and the only criticism with breakfast would be that there was no soap and paper towels at the sink to wash one hands if they get soiled or sticky. The room was exceptionally clean and fresh and as others said about the bathroom, there is no place to hang the towels after use. No towel bars at all. But, I'm being picky here and I did speak to the Mgr. about it. He said they were still in the process of their upgrades and would address the issue. There is an in room safe and a good closet. The area is nice with bus and subway close at hand. What more could you ask for in midtown Manhattan than a reasonable price, close to transportation, with your first meal of the day covered. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnot get better hotel and better service than Ramada Eastside.”
Reviews.Author: tanbir
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ramada Eastside from April 30 through May 06, 2009 and it is never forgetable experience. The hotel was very clean with very friendly and proactive staff. The breakfast served was very fresh. On top of everything it is the best valued hotel. For the month of April, it was pretty reasonable. I won't get better hotel and better service than Ramada Eastside. it is perfect! i loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ColPol
Reviews.Content: This was a great find in New York, given the cost of most other forms of accommodation in the city. As has been said often in the reviews here, itâ€™s in an excellent location only a few blocks away from places like the Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden â€“ and around a 15 minute walk or so from Grand Central Station. Thereâ€™s also a subway station nearby. The room was clean and perfectly adequate with a nice, comfortable bed; well-sized flatscreen TV and a newish shower/bath. They also provided a free breakfast while I was staying there. I didnâ€™t encounter too many problems with noise from outside the room, either. The only thing that bothered me was the customer service (or lack of it). Some of the staff seriously need to do a customer service course and/or to go to hotels in other parts of the world to learn about how to interact with (and even give an occasional smile to or indulge in a friendly conversation with) their guests. But, the further I travelled across the USA, the more a lack of customer service seemed to be standard practice in a lot of different parts of the country these days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: NemoTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in April, and booked the hotel, after having enjoyed a stay last year. The hotel has been renovated in the meantime, and we had a large, nice double queen room. Our room was very clean and everything in perfect condition. The hotel is situated in Murray Hill, 2-3 blocks from the No. 6 Subway. Nice neighbourhood with lots of good restaurants. Breakfast ok, although breakfastroom in basement is too small. Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent value for money, and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bostonnona
Reviews.Content: Just had another great stay at the hotel. My family of three have stayed a few time & this trip consisted of two moms & 2 children under the age of 12. The staff is very friendly & helpful. The rooms were clean & updated. One complaint is that the bathrooms could use extra hooks or more counter space to put your gear. Other than that, great location good price. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good deal for location.”
Reviews.Author: nskyline
Reviews.Content: I used Google Maps to locate hotels within reasonable walking distance from NYU College of Dentistry. I knew I wanted wireless internet, 24 hour front desk and breakfast included in the hotel I was going to stay at. This place was the cheapest that I found within 15-20 mins walking distance from the NYUCD areathat had these amenities. The guy working in the lobby was pretty nice and helpful! At around 130 dollars this place was pretty good. The toilet was kind of close to the wall but I did not mind too much (Perhaps it was just my room). My room was sort of noisy when I was trying to sleep but I think my window was open a little. I got a smoking room since that was all they seemed to have at the time but I don't think I could hold that against the hotel's rating. I would recommend this place if you are going for an interview at NYUCD. Close the the Koreatown area and the Empire State building. Take the New York Airport Service from La Guardia airport if you are trying to get here. It cost me 21 bucks (plus tips) round trip (they drop you off/pick up at Grand Central Station and a few other stations). I just walked (did not mind since I was sightseeing too) to the hotel from there. I think NYAS has a shuttle service to hotels from Grand Central but I just walked since I wanted to see the city closer. Overall I would stay here again bc/ of the relatively cheaper price compared to similarly equipped hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel at a good price for the location”
Reviews.Author: kironb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights while in town on business - rate was ~$125 (AAA discounted) for a king bed room. Good: - Very clean and quiet room (even though it was facing Lexington Ave) on 10th floor - Good selection of food at the breakfast buffet - Wireless high-speed network was fast & free - Good location in Murray Hill - lots of places to eat in the neighborhood Bad: - Slowest elevators I've experienced in years - Fitness room facilities were below par - Fairly old heating/cooling system in room - this should have been upgraded when they renovated the hotel - Breakfast area opened at 7 AM - this is pretty late for weekdays at most hotels

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: livechica95
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price of this hotel, what an awesome value! Friendly helpful staff. Clean room and bathroom. Very comfortable bed. The continental breakfast hit the spot, good bagels, donuts and coffee. The neighborhood is nice with all the necessities near by, pizza, diner, bars, coffee house right next door, pharmacy, subway, etc. I am a single woman and stayed here by myself 4 nights and never once did I feel uncomfortable or unsafe. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suntzuphil
Reviews.Content: Ramada Inn East side New York City, truly fantastic hotel February 13,2009 My wife and i arrived from the Philippines for our exhibit attendance in Javits Center and we again tried Ramada Inn due to its price and proximity to location. We were here two years ago and we were comfortable with the location especially for us who knows very few things about New York. We were very gladly surprised with the new lay out and design of the rooms as well as the fantastic improvements they have made on the bed, the bathroom as well as the general cleanliness of the room. The breakfast was just right, the service good and men and women on the counter were helpful and of course the flat tv was just really a highlight. Ramada truly made our stay memorable and almost became a paradise to us after a 20 hour trip from the Philippines to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Dims57
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times on business trips and this year was better than last. The rooms are large for New York hotel rooms and they are gradually being upgraded so the street facing ones now have modern bathrooms which are great, but you have to put up with the very noisy streets below - definitely makes you feel like you're in NYC! The bed was new too, very comfortable but the pillows are rock hard and too large so we both had sore necks after 3 nights there. There is a large air con machine by the window and massive flat screen TV and coffee making facilities, there's also a small gym and breakfast is included, although it is self service cheap processed food on stryofoam crockery with plastic utensils so best avoided - plenty of nice cafes and shops nearby for food and drink. Two blocks from 28th St subway stop so easy to get around, although you can easily walk to 5th Avenue, Union Sq, Empire State, Madison Sq gardens etc. Great value for money and does what is says on the tin.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: NODAK1979
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that when you're in NYC, perhaps more than any other city, you're paying for a place to sleep. There is just far too much to do to be worrying about all the little amenities. My main cares when in NYC are that I have a semi-quiet place to sleep, it's clean, and it's safe. If those are fulfilled, I"m happy. I'll save the fretting over marble countertops and deluxe lobbies to when I'm elsewhere. This hotels is basically "no frills" in that the rooms are pretty tiny, the TV is pretty small, and the view wasn't really great. Plus, the bathrooms are realllllly small. But, it was clean, the people were very friendly, the part of town was pretty nice and quiet, and the breakfast was good. All this for 130 bucks a night in Manhattan. How could I complain?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: travelokpa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 12/19/08. Hotel was close to my family. Searched Tripadvisor and noticed great reviews. Booked hotel with 2 queen beds Room 1014 on 10th floor. Was supprised when I got off elevator and noticed how bright the hallway was. Ceiling lights every 10 feet. Room was recently remodeled. Bathroom was new and spotless. Bathroom was a good size with space to place all bathroom items. Bed was excellent. Dresser and deck/chair were good. Lighting was excellent. Clock/radio was wireless and contained ipod docking station. Temporary parking in front of hotel. ICON parking garage 3 blocks away with Hotel rate of $20 Regular rate $40. Breakfast was excellent with fresh local bakery donuts and bagles. Attendent did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: IowaTraveler404
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, a reasonable price by New York standards and a free continential breakfast. It is within walking distance of many of the tourist attractions. The rooms are not large but the beds are very comfortable. It was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: BothSidesofthePond
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews and spending endless hours searching for a NYC hotel for under $300 a night, I caught a "sale" on a room in this hotel. I used to live in NYC and visit there quite often, but I was shocked at how difficult it was to find a room over Columbus Day weekend. I was able to make a reservation through the Ramada website directly without having to pay the whole stay in advance, which was a relief. The hotel was very recently refurbished. Rooms and bathrooms were small, but newly decorated and very clean. Front desk staff was okay, but they did answer the few questions I asked them. I was able to check in at 1pm which was appreciated since I had flown all night. Continental breakfast was better than most hotels of this type in New York. IPOD/MP3 player connection was appreciated. I could even use a computer downstairs to check in for my flight. Nice coffee shop next door. Location was a little far from midtown ($10.00 by taxi), but subway stop was only about 5 minutes away. All in all, a great find for a busy weekend in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Catherine-Dublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night in September. Was anxious having seen some of the reviews but I found it to be very good. Rooms and Bathrooms appear to be recently refurbished (stayed on the 8th floor) and very clean. Breakfast had a good selection and all was well maintained and clean. Good location for visiting the city. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Von26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week at the Ramada Eastside and we were very pleased with our stay. Compared to prices at other hotels in Manhattan it was good value. Great location. Few minutes walk to Empire State Building and about 20 minutes to Times Square and Rockefeller Centre. Good amount of restaurants nearby and also on 3rd Avenue. Italian restaurant next door to the hotel was lovely. Unlike most hotels this hotel provides a complimentary breakfast and the breakfast was excellent with plenty variety of food and drinks. Kitchen staff kept replenishing the stock if any food ran low. All staff throughout the hotel were very pleasant, helpful and obliging. The beds are extremely comfortable too! Really nice. Rooms were kept clean. Phones in the bedrooms allow free calls to anywhere in the US. Lifts might be a bit slow but there are only 12 floors altogether so it doesn't take very long to get to your floor. Our only complaint would be that our room had no mirror except for the mirror in the bathroom. Also, the television remote control was temperamental. Would only work if held at a certain angle. Nice television though! All in all we had a great experience and a great week in New York. Would definitely stay at Ramada Eastside again.

Reviews.Title: “Raves for the the Ramada Inn Eastside”
Reviews.Author: NoDakGirl
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a reasonable hotel that offers rooms with 2 queen beds and free breakfast, this is definitely the hotel for you. My mom, sister, best friend and I planned a trip to NYC to celebrate my 30th birthday. My mother insisted on staying at a hotel with queen beds instead of full, and her internet search with that criteria brought us to the Ramada Inn Eastside. We booked online, and when we arrived, we were greeted by a friendly staff who were very accomodating for our entire stay. Our room was much larger than we expected, and the beds were so comfortable that my mother is looking into ordering one for herself. We loved that our location was so close to so many major attractions, and we used that to our full advantage, often walking to and from the hotel as we explored the city. When we had to take a cab, it was usually only a few dollars to anywhere we wanted to go. Throughout the trip, we marveled at how lucky we were to stumble on such a great hotel for such a reasonable price (not to mention bigger beds than the competition!), and the complimentary breakfast was the icing on the cake! It's not the Ritz or the Four Seasons, but for a clean comfortable night's stay in a convenient location, you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most Comfortable Bed Ever . . . but not a minute's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: leeleebee
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on short notice, without really knowing much about it, except that it was close to NYU Medical Center, and I got a very inexpensive rate for NYC. I had a super tiny queen bed room, but it had all of the things it needed -- a closet, a desk, flat screen tv, and a small but clean bathroom. The bed's mattress is Tempur-Pedic -- quite possibly the most comfortable mattress I have ever slept on. However, I didn't get any sleep all night! There were two problems -- first, this room and the room next to mine had their doors practically touching. Every time the people in the next room entered and exited their room . . . it sounded like they were coming into my room. Second, the road noise was crazy. I could hear people talking on the street as if they were in my room -- and I was on the 11th floor! Every car, bus, ambulance that drove by, I heard! Yes, I know this is NYC, the "City That Never Sleeps" . . . but the noise was so loud that I checked the window two times to make sure that I hadn't left it open! I probably can't much blame the hotel for this problem . . . but if you value your sleep, you won't get much here.

Reviews.Title: “very good position”
Reviews.Author: wright139
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at this hotel. Our family room was all we needed (2 queen sized beds) and breakfast was included. The beds were extremely comfortable - they were Tempura mattresses. Just about had views of the Empire State Building from our window but main attractions within walking distance. Great diner just up the road. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelingpossum
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a nice hotel and we would definitely stay there again. Things we liked: - Good location. Near subways; many restaurants nearby. Penelopes across the street was very good for dinner and breakfast. Many Indian restaurant in the vicinity. Chennai Garden (a few blocks away) was excellent; the best meal we had in New York. - Large rooms. I was prepared for the small rooms that New York is known for, but the room was extremely spacious and had been recently renovated. - Comfortable beds. The most comfortable bed I've ever slept in in a hotel. Things we did not like: - Front desk staff was not very friendly or very helpful. They usually could not be bothered to say hello when we walked through the lobby. They could not tell us where the nearest Chinese restaurant was or where a public computer could be found. - Marginal continental breakfast. Little variety; the same expired yogurt remained available for our entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for prime time.”
Reviews.Author: Travels_too_muchUtah
Reviews.Content: It IS possible to get deals on hotels in NYC. I paid full price for this one, and it was not worth it. If you could get a great rate, it would be. I was on a newly renovated floor, so everything was new, but it was not quite finished! When I checked in, the phones didn't work (they did they next day). I had to call the front desk from my cell. Both days, the windows stuck open--sans screen--and someone had to come up to close it. I had to call and ask for a hairdryer and took a cold shower because the water took too long to get hot. The "fitness room" only has one machine plugged in. I think that once all the renovations and upgrades are done, this will be a fine hotel if you can get a good price. The staff and management are VERY nice and helpful. They are trying hard, but my room was not ready for prime time.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean Accommodations - Ramada Inn Eastside”
Reviews.Author: seikohog
Reviews.Content: My Dad and I stayed at the Ramada Inn Eastside on a trip to see the Yankees play in May 2008. The staff was friendly enough at check-in. When we got to the room, we found it small, but very clean. The beds (2 double) were very comfortable. The bathroom was nice and modern and again, very clean. I guess I didn't expect it to be as nice as it was (don't get me wrong, it's not luxurious, just nice and comfortable). We were both very pleased with the accommodations. Breakfast was ok - a typical continental breakfast. The attendant there wasn't overly friendly. Seating space is limited, so be sure to get there before the rush. The breakfast area is a little cramped and people seemed to stumble over one another to get to the food. There is a nice Italian restaurant next door and some great Indian food on 28th. The subway is within walking distance and we felt safe in the neighborhood. My only complaint would be the cost, but the Ramada Inn Eastside was the best rate we could find at the time in that area.

Reviews.Title: “always nice and easy”
Reviews.Author: ishevans
Reviews.Content: We stay here several times a year...even tho they are renovating, it was still the best around. The staff is always accomodating and by NYC standards the rooms are always well appointed....not big but again, it is New York. A great starter breakfast and the location is terrific.....close to everything, easy cab service and bus or subway nearby...nice little coffee haus downstairs. Many foreign guests...they know value and quality. For the price.....cannot be beat in a location parallel.

Reviews.Title: “good location, ok price, clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: coffeeBeanTelAviv
Reviews.Content: Spent in the hotel one night, and it was pretty good experience. I called from the airport at 10:30 asking for an early check in (at 11:30) and answered that it will take a bit more bit it's doable. well... it took a bit more than promised and I had to wait a bit in the cafe near by (which was pretty nice - good coffee, nice atmosphere, but don't be tempted by the coconut muffin...), but I got in by 12:00. the room was pretty nice. small, but greatly lighten with sun. the bath and toilet are pretty miniature (I'm not too big man, but it was feeling like sitting on a training pot, rather than on a toilet seat. there is a breakfast included - pretty nice continental one. one minor thing... someone should reset the alarm clocks after a guest is leaving the room... (that goes for ALL the hotels...) I don't need to remember to shut someones else's alarm on the morning of my day off.... one last thing... don't want to be picky, but the elevators are s-l-o-w.... I was on the 12th floor... bottom line: great location - Lexington and 30. the room was clean and tidy restroom a bit claustrophobic ok breakfast take 5 mins ahead of schedule to catch the elevator nice cafe near by will come again once I'll be in NYC

Reviews.Title: “All The More Reason to Visit the City!”
Reviews.Author: rjenack23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit more money than I wanted to spend for one night's stay in the city. However, this was easily one of the nicest rooms I've stayed in while in NYC, and the location was absolutely IDEAL. I was walking distance from everywhere I needed to go during my weekend visit (and walking distance is saying a lot for NYC). Upon my arrival I was informed by the very pleasant female attendant that they were doing some remodeling of the rooms on the floor where my room was located. I had booked the first room to be finished on that floor. We briefly joked about it being especially set aside for me because they knew I was coming. I always love a hotel staff that is friendly and has a sense of humor, but who doesn't? As the elevator doors opened to the 11th floor I was met with a hallway full of furniture, TV's, and styrofoam packaging materials. At first I was a little nervous, but once I was shown to my room by one of the employees (since the rooms had not yet been marked) I was met with an adorable room that I was so pleased with! The employee was very kind and asked me to make sure everything was there that I needed, and that if anything was missing to please let him know immediately so that he could attend to my requests. I stayed in a standard Queen room. The bed had a Tempurpedic mattress that was amazing; the color and design themes for the room were very nice and warm; the bathroom was HUGE for a single occupant room!; the furniture was simple, yet very nice; and the large window by the closet space actually had a nice little view "overlooking" the city. The room came with a nice air conditioner (functional and NOT musty smelling!) that came in handy with the 85* weather that day. I settled in for about an hour before leaving for a meeting a few blocks away. Upon arriving back to my room about 4 hours later the hallways were spotless, the rooms marked, and everything looked as though there was never remodeling or construction in the first place. I was very pleased with my weekend experience and have already begun making plans to stay there again when I return to the city in a few weeks for a more extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: laguys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Eastside for 4 nights in June, 2008 and it was the worst experience in NYC we have ever had. We booked online through the hotel website 2 months prior and called the hotel one week before to confirm. They gave us a nice room but said we had to move to another room the next night because of remodeling. I asked why they didn't book us into the same room for the 4 nights, but the receptionist didn't know. She said the new room would be exactly like the first room. Well, it wasn't. It was about half the size and a smoking room. Since we specifically asked for non-smoking, we complained. They said it wasn't a smoking room (lie) and besides they didn't have any other rooms. I complained again and again and demanded to speak to the manager. He wasn't there and wouldn't be there for 2 days, so the receptionist didn't know what to do. I kept complaining and he finally offered to move us to a "sister hotel" near Times Square. He said it was far superior to the Ramada Eastside and that the new hotel would give us a big discount, half the price of the Ramada. Well, we looked it up online and the new hotel was 2 stars below the Ramada and the "big discount" was the regular price. In other words, it was a cheaper hotel, and in NYC that means lower quality in all ways. We asked him to lower the Ramada price because we didn't want to move again, and he agreed to do that. That night, our son urinated in his bed, and we asked Housekeeping to change the sheets. Well, they didn't put new sheets on the bed. When we got back and were ready to go to bed, we discovered this and asked for sheets. The hotel person came and didn't want to change the sheets himself, but I refused to do it, so he did it. The final experience was that we asked them to call us car service to take us to the airport. It turns out the car was unlicensed, had an open beer bottle in the back seat, and one of the seatbelts was broken. We went half a block and the driver demanded more money than the original flat fee. It seems the hotel receptionist pocketed ten dollars and didn't tell the car driver, who wanted an additional ten dollars from us. We demanded he take us back to the hotel and we caught a taxi. I strongly advise you to carefully weight the very negative management style against the free breakfast and decide what is worth more to your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: annsankey
Reviews.Content: I originally booked this hotel for its convenient location and reasonable rates. We weren't disappointed. I've now stayed at the hotel three times and would not hesitaste to recommend it to friends and family. There is a good complimentary breakfast and free interenet access. The room was clean and the staff were all polite and helpful. The only problem on this last visit was that the room was very small - hardly room for two suitacses - and there was a lot of traffic noise which is not surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Small, but pretty clean; good location”
Reviews.Author: PleaseTakeMe2
Reviews.Content: We booked through the hotel's web site for $109 double room. The staff was friendly, a bit stand-offish, but helpful enough. The room was very tiny, but the beds were clean and so was the bathroom. The hotel is partly condos on some floors, so it was interesting to mingle with the locals on the way in/out. The hotel room has and old feel to it. We didn't see any of the creepy-crawlies that some travelers have complained about. We only used our hotel as a base to facilitate scheduled auditions for our kids in NYC. It was well worth the $109, as we were hardly ever in the room; but, I was happy with the general cleanliness of the room for bathing and sleeping. I would give the hotel another chance if I could get the same nightly rate. Hotel is within great walking distance of Broadway other major streets/aves. Great pizza/shopping just blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent discount hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fugitive85
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Eastside Inn 161 Lexington Ave., New York, NY This hotel is in the Murray Hill section at the corner of Lexington Ave. and East 30th St. We stayed on the tenth floor for three nights in mid-April 2008. Two adults - king sized bed - non- smoking. Per night cost, taxes and fees included was about $270. We had an excellent experience. The service people were friendly and helpful. The room, like many in New York, was small, but it was clean, bathroom included. Basic cable and a basic television. The continental breakfast was great. Bagels, cereal, donuts, waffles, juice, fruit, and coffee -- all fresh and in abundance. And a cleaning woman maintains the room constantly, cleaning and replenishing. You are a few blocks from the nearest subway stops, but you can easily walk to the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building, Grand Central Station, and the Flatiron District. You are also right next door to a wonderful Italian restaurant, Trattoria Belvedere. Dinner for two with appetizer, wine, dessert and tip - $130 (generous tip for very good service). If you seek high-priced luxury, look elsewhere, but if you plan to see the many sights of NYC and use your hotel simply as a base of operation, this might be the place for you. We certainly plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy crawlies”
Reviews.Author: 4CatMom
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel in 2004 and my visit was pleasant at that time. So when I booked it again for a 3-night stay for 3 individuals I was surprised that the conditions were much worse. The condition of the room had deteriorated from my earlier visit in 2004. There was peeling wallpaper and the air vents did not look very clean and made a peculiar noise even when turned off. I could not find another hotel that had 3 rooms available in my price range so decided to stick it out. One of my traveling companions saw cockroaches on our last night there and the staff on duty just handed him a can of insecticide and said they would handle it the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in mid Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: nigecox
Reviews.Content: On arrival we could tell the hotel was old-fashioned and tired in its furnishings, however the room was clean. The reception staff were helpful and pleasant. We booked very early and paid $140 per night and consider it excellent value because of the location, superb mattresses, free Wi-Fi internet connection and the eat-as-much-as-you-like cold buffet breakfast. The breakfast room along with all the public areas were clean and tidy. We had a large two-queen beds size room which was nice, with a view of the Empire State building from the window.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel - Poor Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: bignk56
Reviews.Content: This hotel was convenient, nice breakfast for a quickie, reasonable cost and close to the hospital where my mom was staying. I was in NYC for family medical reasons and the hospital had a listing of several hotels in the area. I called every one of them and finally picked this hotel. I got a price quote for the five nights and it was faxed pretty quickly. I arrived on a Friday and before I went to my room, I asked Ela at the desk how much it would cost to upgrade the room to two beds. I was told $20 dollars. I said fine when my Dad comes to NYC he can share a room rather than getting his own. By Sunday I asked Preya for the room upgrade and the price went up to $60 more. I said that is not I was quoted and thought to wait the next night. Monday I asked the nice guy Henry or Harry and he gave me the upgrade for $20. Tuesday went to the hospital for the day and came back with my dad. Went to the room and it was locked out. Came back to the desk and Preya said I didn't sign out in time and they were holding my bags. I asked for the manager and she said she was the manager. She said the price is $60 more. I told her I was quoted twice by two others and the extra cost is $20. She said since I am signing in without reservations the price went up. I told her she increased the price two days before and I had reservations. She eventually got me the real manager and he was not helpful either. I paid the difference since I had no where to go with an 82 year old parent standing in a hallway waiting to get our belongings. Ela and Henry or Harry whatever his name was, was nice and polite. I will never forget the rude and uncaring manager(s) and I will contact the hospital to let them know about the inconsistencies within their own group. I understand prices change every day but to change and flip flop on charges every other day with the same person is rather suspicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, good restaurants nearby too!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentIpswichFlyer
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to stay that is reasonably priced, with clean rooms and friendly staff, then this is the place for you! I'd had a very bad NY hotel experience in the past but this one is great. We didn't have to wait long to check in, we were given a list of the hotel's amenities and the wifi is also free which was great. The bed was also very comfy - perfect for when you're trying to adjust to a different time zone and we loved the coffee maker with proper filter coffee. We were greeted everytime we went in and out of the hotel which was nice and something you don't get from a bigger hotel. We could even see the Chrysler building from our hotel room window. My only niggle was that there was only one lift as the other wasn't working but that's minor really. There were loads of restaurants around and the Italian one next door is superb. The Ramada also has a good selection of leaflets in their foyer about what to do in the city including money off vouchers if you go to the Rockerfeller building. If you're after a good bar as well, I'd recommend "The Watering Hole" on 106 East 19th Street. If I'm lucky enough to go back to New York, then I'll definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quick trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: jbrown68
Reviews.Content: Some hotels you visit because you want to luxuriate in the hotel experience. Others you stay at because they are clean, affordable, safe ways to visit a city. The Ramada is definitely the latter, and it was just perfect. It's two blocks from a parking garage (they validate--still expensive to park, but way cheaper than parking anywhere else!)--two blocks from the 6 train, and near plenty of places to grab a bite. I stayed with my two little ones, and we were quite comfortable. The room was small, but plenty big enough for the three of us. Quite clean. Quite comfortable. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was pretty decent. Lots of selections--yogurt, bagels, hardboiled eggs, donuts, cereals, waffles, breads--plus of course juices and coffee. The only downside was the nastiest look I got from the guy stocking the room when I accidentally dropped my coffee cup. The guy shot daggers at me! The only other interaction I had with a staff member was at the front desk, and she was a very pleasant woman who noticed that I was accidentally booked into a smoking room and she quickly fixed it for me. I'd definitely stay here again. The price was just right and I felt safe and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Camiss
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel.I've been to Ny a few times and even if I try new hotels I always end up at Ramada Inn.I've been to this hotel alone sometimes or with my boyfriend. I think the location is great, it's not really far from things, if you like to walk there are many attractions at a walking distance(5-7 blocks away) or if you want you can just ride a cab what is usually not expensive considering most places are not far at all... And it's great cause it's a great neighborhood, there are many restaurants nearby but still it's not that crowded or noisy. Honestly the rooms are small, but I've seen much smaller in NY. It's small but still big enough(I always come with 2 giant packages).The rooms are very clean and comfortable, also the views are great. And the maids are all very nice too, as someone else already mentioned.I feel at home here!The people from the front desk were not exactly friendly but they were pretty efficient.There are many services included, such as free internet service, free phone calls for all over the US, free breakfast(and it's a nice breakfast!!!).The TV has a good size too, and cable is free.I've been to other hotels where I paied a little cheaper but had to pay crazy prices for TV, internet ,breakfast, phone...it's just not worth it! And the average price I pay when i stay is $130 dollars, and this is a good price for Manhattan and for everything you get here. So I highly recommend this hotel! Camila S.

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: ch42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week due to a family emergency in NY. The hotel is great value - lovely free continental breakfast, free internet access, free daily newspaper, free local calls from room and answermachine. The beds are very comfortable although there is traffic noise which is expected everywhere in a major city. The staff are very friendly. Outside there are many restaurants and diners. 5 mins walk to Empire State building, Macys, Broadways etc. Get a weekly travel pass for $24 each bought in subway for buses/tube this saves fortune as taxis can be expensive. Highly recommended if you are on a buget - we paid Â£500in January which is pretty reasonable for 2 in queen sized room. Has TV satellite - ensuite bathroom,pay movies or use of nintendo.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place in manhattan”
Reviews.Author: bebe12
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel over Christmas period. Although the front staff was rude and unfriendly, this hotel is centrally located with the subway only 5 minutes away. Great rate in central manhattan. The area seems to be a little India so lots of indian and other types of restaurants around. Wouldn't walk around too much in the night time though - dubious characters here and there in the area. We took a standard room which was very small but since it was just a place to stay, I didn't mind. Overall, decent as long as one does not have to deal too much with the sour faced receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, great location, nice staff, adequate room”
Reviews.Author: wly3x1
Reviews.Content: OUTSTANDING rates (about $140/night AARP) for midtown NYC. Location is in residential area - you can walk around like a local in a less frenzied atmosphere. Subway and Bus stops a short walk away. Very nice staff overcomes tiny, cramped rooms - but you're not going to stay in the room day and night. Rooms are close to each other (a bit noisy if you have inconsiderate neighbors) and 'clean enough' to get by. Wonderful restaurant right across the street: Penelope's - inexpensive good food, breakfast, lunch, & dinner but cash only, no reservations. Book through Ramada or applecorehotels websites for discounted rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than I expected”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaGirl98
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a recent trip to New York. The last New York Ramada I stayed in (on 34th Street) was horrible, so I was a bit nervous about trying this one. The building looks kind of old from the outside, but it turned out to be quite nice inside. My room had two beds so it had plenty of room for just one person. It had the usual array of amenties--coffee maker, hair dryer, iron. Everything was clean. There is a business center with Internet access that you can use for free, as well as free breakfast. The people at the front desk were friendly. The location on the corner of Lexington and 30th is a few blocks from the subway. That particular corner is relatively quiet so there isn't much noise from the street. I had accumulated enough points through one of my rewards programs to get a free night here. But the standard rate is $250, which is too expensive for me. I would stay here again if I could get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “I really loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: phyrn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The location is fantastic. Away from all the tourist crowds and in a great neighborhood. Most of the staff isn't "friendly", but were generally helpful (and c'mon. it's New York!). But the maid was delightful. She would be singing somewhat quietly but cheerfully in the mornings. Always said "Hello!", was careful not to invade your room when you didn't want to be disturbed, and her demeanor was a pleasant way to start the day. The rooms are smallish, but great for New York. And the view was spectacular. Our room was on the 12th (highest) floor. I loved laying in bed and being able to see into the city. The (FREE!) breakfast was fantastic!!! So many options. Cereal, bagels, breads, donuts (real donuts. Like fresh from the bakery donuts). They had a separate cooler unit with yogurt and, get this, Red Bull (both regular and sugar free). The coffee was always burned, but there's a cute little cafe next door w/ great coffee and fabulous vanilla lattes. Free wireless internet. Nice closet. Good desk space. Again, small by most other standards, but very decent for New York. Small workout space, but at least it existed. The architecture and layout of the building was so quaint and classic. My biggest complaint, of course, has to be the price. But it's pretty average for New York, so I can't dock it too much for that. I would totally stay here again. Wish it were a bit cheaper, but if you're coming to NY, it's kind of what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Bad...”
Reviews.Author: TheGlobetraveler
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a convention at the Javits Center 10/21-26 and stayed here as the best option @ a AAA rate of $246 a night. Having an MTA bus/rail schedule I knew that by walking 4 blocks you can catch the M34 crosstown bus directly to the convention center (17 min). It also passes Penn station, so I purchased a 7 day unlimited metro local bus/rail pass upon arrival for $24 and proceeded to get off at the Lexington St. stop. Buses run about every 10 minutes. Local metro transportation options are easy and the hotel has MTA maps and numerous brochures. The Murray Hill Deli @ Lexington and 34th is the best option for sandwiches/beverages/sundries etc. I Checked-in @ 8:45PM and presented my TripRewards card and Id, however when presented with the invoice, noticed that I was being charged at a higher than my AAA rate reserved through the website. I questioned why my rate had changed and she said because I hadn't showed my AAA membership card. I countered "you never asked for it", and showed my card (she made a photocopy) and reservation copy, at which point she changed the rate. During this process I noticed that they have a sign behind the desk about 8 feet high (I'm 6'3), stating that you must present AAA or other discount ID upon check-in to obtain that rate. Not a very classy methodology in my opinion. This is a charming, small, older renovated hotel, in the Murray Hill residential neighborhood, with about 10-15 rooms per floor.
