I reserved a double queen and was initially given room 1101. Unfortunately, after a few minutes I realized that the floor was wet for about 2 meters outside of the bath, and remembering another sign on the wall at check-in, regarding immediately reporting water leaks; I went straightly to the front desk and was promptly assigned to room 601. Both rooms are in the left back corner of the hotel with a view over some lower buildings and through the alley to the street, however very quiet. The room was small as always in NYC, and contained the two beds and a chair next to the one window. The Tempurpedic beds were comfortable, however I noticed the already occurring inward sag towards the middle with one. The bathroom is small and configured so that you have to close the door to sit on the toilet, which was a little annoying. However, there is a phone in the bathroom and the "Arc" shower curtain providing more space in the combo tub. I had some problems with the CATV and lost all channels for parts of one night and ESPN only another. The hotel free WiFI worked great and after once inputting the login/password (obtained from the desk) recognized me for the week. An open LinkSys network is also available. The room was clean and the service good. The hotel contains a small gym with solely 3 pieces of aerobic equipment. There is also a public gym located 2 blocks away. The continental breakfast is pretty good as they go, although they need to splurge for some new double toasters, as one has a sign saying "don't use" (one side works according to the attendant) and the other works intermittently. On my fourth day my room key no longer worked and I had to get another from the desk. The next day that key no longer worked and I got another from the desk. I immediately went to my room and that key also did not work. Subsequently, a hotel staff member escorted me to the room with a new one that did work. I tried unsuccessfully to explain the possible need for some new room keys (limited useful life of the magnetic strip) to the young receptionist during my check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SnowBanks
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights here and loved it - location was great ~ 20 blocks to Times square, but 2 blocks from subway station. Hotel staff were not all that welcoming, but the room, although small was everything we needed, bug-free and clean. The room was very quiet as well. We did not want to pay more than $200/night and from what I hear this hotel is probably the best value for that price range. Good sized bathroom, but toilet didn't flush all that well. Complimentary continental breakfast was nice. AMAZING indian food 2 blocks down called Curry in a Hurry, a few times we just ordered it and ate back in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but good”
Reviews.Author: Snarky
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with a little trepidation because it's been at least 20 years since I had a good experience with a Ramada Inn. Usually they're a bit shabby. However, all the usual mid-range hotels I like to stay at (Courtyard, Hampton) were either booked solid or $600/night, so I gave this one a shot. This hotel is pretty good. It's not luxury, but the room was spotless, the furnishings recent, the Tempurpedic bed was comfortable, and the room was fairly quiet once you turned on the air conditioning. I have no real complaints. Like pretty much everything in New York, this is an older building that has been refurbished. I had a room with one queen bed, which was a little claustrophobic, but the closet was big enough to put my luggage in there so I wouldn't trip over it. WiFi Access is free and works well. (Call the front desk to get the password to login.) The shower controls are a little tricky. As you turn the knob at first, it goes from cold to lukewarm to no water, back to cold-ish. If you stop at the lukewarm before you hit the spot where the water stops, you'll get a surprise when the water heats up! The trick is to open the valve all the way and wait for the water to heat - it will be cold at first, but will be perfect in a couple of minutes. I'm not sure if every room is like this, but it's what I experienced in mine. The neighborhood is great - very residential. You feel like you're living in New York walking through this neighborhood, not like you're a tourist. The hotel serves a free continental breakfast if you want to carbo load on bagels, donuts, and cereal. There is a coffee shop next door to the lobby that serves eggs, and the excellent Murray Hill Diner is a couple of blocks away on Lex if you'd like something else. I'd stay here again. I'm still a little skittish on Ramada Inns in general, but this is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel + location and a good price”
Reviews.Author: MrsKCork
Reviews.Content: If you looking for a hotel in New York that's not going to break the bank then this hotel has everything you would need for your stay. Ensuite rooms, a good continental breakfast, friendly staff, internet access and within walking distance to all the major sites. We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Inn Eastside..”
Reviews.Author: jpjeff
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was average at Best. Location was not too bad from Times Square about a 15 Minute Taxi Ride in the evening. The staff was luke warm and unfriendly at times but other times they were fine. My last morning I notice a rodent baite station next to the Heating/AC unit. I did not see any signs of rodents in the room but I was not happy to see the baite station in the room. The Ramada Inn's Wireless connection is very poor, I was able to make it work for an hour each morning and then like clock work it would cut out. There is Telephone Tech Support for their inhouse Wireless Network, when I called they would reboot their server and it would work for a short time but then cut off. I was on vacation so it maybe have been fate.. But if you need to be connected don't count on their Wireless connection. The elevators are small but hey you don't spend a lot of time in the Elevators.. All in all I would probably look for another Hotel next time to NYC but if I could not find a reasonble hotel somewhere else, I would **PROBABLY** stay at the RAMADA Inn once again.. Good Luck!!!

Reviews.Title: “For the Price and Location, It's Fine”
Reviews.Author: Cyberworld Toronto
Reviews.Content: The property is fine for the price and the location. If you are not too choosy and just want an inexpensive location to sleep at night with a decent, free breakfast in the morning, this property is fine. The property also has a Brazilian coffee shop attached to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: prakashpt
Reviews.Content: The room was clean & functional. Worth its price !

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: DavidBelgium
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in june during the week for 4 nights. I chose the Ramada because on weekdays most hotels with 3 or 4 stars were 400-600$ a night this period. The room (king bed) was clean, so was the bathroom. A friend of mine stayed in a room with queen bed, the room was very small and I wouldn't recommend it for two persons. The room was simple but ok, the mattress was very good. Complimentary internet (although I think that's only for king-rooms) was very convenient, so was the complimentary breakfast (fruit, yoghourt, donuts, bread, juices, coffee, ...). I'm giving the ramada inn eastside only a two out of five because I think the room certainly wasn't worth the 214$ a night I paid. If you can get a rate around 100$ or a bit more I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value BUT overcharged and not offered a refund”
Reviews.Author: kespeer
Reviews.Content: I would be writing a favorable review about my stay in Feb (clean, good location) but I recently sent friends there and had a bad experience. I booked rooms through my travel agent and sent friends there with reservations that said $161 per night. The hotel charged almost a HUNDRED dollars more and would NOT issue a refund. Leaves a nasty taste in the mouth... I am not sure if this is happening to online bookers as well...

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for New York City”
Reviews.Author: Suzzsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ramada Eastside from May 8-11, 2007 during a time in New York City when hotel rates were astronomical and availability was limited. We were able to book a room with two queen beds at the AAA rate for a little over $200 per night when most other hotels were charging $400 per night or more. We arrived at the hotel at 10:00 a.m. prepared to store our luggage until check-in time, but to our surprise we were able to check in to our room immediately. Our nonsmoking room was very clean and quiet (even though the room was located close to the elevator). The room was not fancy but quite spacious and functional (with free wireless high-speed internet access). The Tempurpedic beds were a new experience and surprisingly comfortable. The hotel has an arrangement for parking with a garage located on East 32nd Street (2 blocks away) for $20 per night. The complimentary continental breakfast was adequate with plenty of fresh coffee (most important to me at breakfast time) and bagels, doughnuts, cold cereal, yogurt and basic fresh fruit (apples and bananas). (There is a wonderful little luncheonette located two blocks away on 28th Street (between Lexington and Third) called Stop 28 that serves very tasty hot breakfasts at reasonable prices.) We also stayed at the Ramada Eastside in April of 2006 in a king room. The room was clean, quiet and functional, but very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, newly remodeled”
Reviews.Author: mbkris
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price. The rooms are newly remodeled and the staff was very nice and helpfull. Great location to everything there is a subway just two blocks away on 28th street. And the breakfest is a plus, a great start to your morning, and they have a bussiness center right across from the breakfest room which is another plus. The area is mostly residential which made me feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in mid-town”
Reviews.Author: AroKhampa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel few times. Great value in a safe area. There are few Indian and Tibetan restaurant nearby. Expect to pay less than half of what you would pay nearby. Little trivia... I am absolutely convinced that the outside shot of this hotel was used as the hotel in Tom Hank's movie,the Terminal, in which he plays the Russian tourist who gets stranded at the Airport in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ERSFallsChurch
Reviews.Content: This travel snob was very impressed with the value for the money. I only stayed here because almost all hotels were booked in the city on my travel dates, and the only other reasonably priced rooms were in higher-rated rooms that got terrible reviews. The Ramada was clean, bathroom was recently updated, and the breakfast was a nice addition. The sheets are a little thin and the towels small, but I would still recommend the hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: joefour4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Inn 30th and lex in Manhattan. It was me my wife and three kids. The room was large with two queens and a roomy bathroom. The location is great. Quiet at night and centally located. A great Itailan rest across the street as well as a great Chinese/ suishi joint next door to the Itailian place. We ate at both places and it was reasonable, both kid friendly. Best part of stay was the new temper-pedic mattresses( next bed I get will be one) and the free breakfast! Bagels, cereal, juice, toast, yogurt, waffles Kids loved it and it all tastes great when free. 189.00 a night room was spacious and clean. Only problem we had is the morning we left no hot water they were having a problem. BED BUGS IS BULL*****. I read it on another review. I am hard on hotesl and restaurants, hard to please, but I cannot complain about the Ramada or restaurants across the street

Reviews.Title: “It's fine, it's clean, and very easy on the wallet!”
Reviews.Author: LindySeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Inn Eastside from March 22nd to March 27th. The price was the lowest I could find in Manhattan for a Murray Hill hotel room with its own bath (179-189 a night). The hotel staff seemed nice, the hotel lobby was very clean (in fact the hotel hallways smell kind of like bleach), and the room was just fine. Remember, this is the Ramada Inn, not the W Hotel, so don't expect lots of space or luxury. But do expect a smallish room (about the size of a typical American bedroom) with a very comfortable bed, a TV in an armoire, desk and chair, night tables, lamps, iron, blow dryer, phone, coffee maker, shampoos, several towels, etc. And a generous free breakfast is served on the lower level each morning. For the price, you could do a lot worse than this solidly middle class hotel! This was a safe and comfortable place. And there were absolutely no bugs! Believe me, I checked this out thoroughly after being terrified by reading reviews after I'd booked the room. The only complaint I had was that the ceramic tiles in the bathroom need to be regrouted as the grout looks kind of stained as years go by, which is not a big deal, just not appealing to look at. There is nowhere to put anything in the bathroom--any little shelf would have been nice. I couldn't put anything on top of the toilet tank because it was slanted, and the little pedestal sink had no room to put anything down. So the hotel management should consider adding a little shelves to the bathrooms. Other than that, this was a fine place to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, gracious staff, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: jimbo26
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8-night stay here. The room was very clean, and we were comfortable the whole time. The weather outside went from 70F the start of the week, to 25F near the end. The room was always comfortable, and we hardly even had to turn on the heat/AC. The rooms are not huge, but we stayed with two kids, and had plenty of space. The building is not new, but seems to be maintained well, and they have clearly done a lot of work lately (new mattresses, carpets, paint, fixtures). The breakfast is normal continental fair, but was a huge money saver. Toast, bagels, donuts, oatmeal, juices, fresh fruit, yogurt, coffee/ energy drinks. Eat well, 'cause the rest of your day in NYC will cost a lot! The staff were all very courteous. Maids were friendly and trustworthy. A plugged toilet was fixed in less than 5 minutes. We will stay here again. PS As a first-time visitor to NYC, EVERY stereotype I had was shattered. Sure, I saw a drunk on the subway, but nothing like what I expected. Everyone was very cordial and helpful. I felt much safer here, than in Chicago or LA. Of course, you have to be aware of your surroundings, but relax and enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and pleasant staff!”
Reviews.Author: villemur
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two young children over St. Patrick's day weekend. Overall we were very pleased with our stay. Our room with two queen beds was larger than expected (I understand that some of the single bed rooms are very small), the hotel was very clean, the Continental breakfast was excellent, the staff was courteous and helpful, and the location is very good. This hotel is a good value and I would consider staying here again. The only real negative is that there is no onsite parking (there is a discounted public garage 2 blocks away), and to unload our vehicle we had to double-park in front of the hotel. However, this was a minor inconvenience in the grand scheme of things and it is generally expected in New York city.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: MaggieM94
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to NYC and a stay at both the Ramada Eastside and the W hotel-Union Square. For the record, I have stayed at this Ramada two times before (in the span of the last two years) and did not have any of the negative experiences as mentioned in other travelers' posts. I was very pleased with the new memory foam mattress in my room at the Ramada, it was actually more comfortable than the mattress at the W! I do also want to mention, that the rooms at the Ramada are small, and the decor is a little worn, but for the price, you can't beat it! The location is central to everything and in my opinion, it is a extra added bonus that it is located in a mainly -residential area. I will also echo the sentiments of earlier posts about the Brasil Coffee shop and the Trattoria Belvedere next door. Both were outstanding! Especially the Trattoria!! The owner was very gracious considering the fact that we were a party of 8 (including two children) with no reservation - we were seated immediately!! The food was spectacular - this coming from a family of italians! Be sure to visit if you can, and leave room for the homemade Tiramisu - it's on the house!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Yakeen
Reviews.Content: Visiting from Canada, staying at the Ramada Inn hotel in New York , 161 Lexington was a wonderful and new experience. It offers the best breakfast, fitness center, room services and clean rooms. The rooms offered new temper pedic beds it was very comfortable and health to experience. This vacation was much better than the other hotels I ever visited in all my years of traveling. But what I really liked was the location of the hotel, located next to the best Brazilian coffee shop and shopping areas. Over all the experience was a joy and a lovely trip. I would recommend this hotel to any of my boss and family member. I was an excellent and way to enjoy a vacation hotel. Aftab Shaid from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Update on Beds Bugs and Broom Sticks”
Reviews.Author: Guest2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 21st of Feb till 23rd. The hotel was clean and well run. The hotel has replaced every single matress and has been cleaned from tip to toe, in January, you'll see that the negative posts are from people that stayed there in November. After reading the posts I had a sleepless night, the night before I was due to arrive in New York, Im from London, UK. Anyway I was really tired, and without anywhere to go late at night I arrived at the hotel. The staff were really nice when I asked if I could pre inspect the room for bugs before I moved in. The staff did not complian but took me to the room where i proceeded to remove the bedding sheets and check every nook and crany of the room (which is a little small but not claustrphobic) I did not find any bugs or even signs of bugs. So I would happily stay there again. I beleive the hotel when they say that they cleaned the place in Jan, Bed bugs are a common problem in many hotels because patrons bring them in so clearing bugs is a constant battle. But the room was clean the breakfast is ample and tasty, the staff are pleasent, the guests are middle class, clean and i had a great experiance, If you are comming by car use the icon parking because they have a special deal which the hotel can explain, it will save you some money. I thought i would put the record straight.

Reviews.Title: “A decent stay at a great price”
Reviews.Author: SkinnyLumpkin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here this past weekend. Overall, it was a fairly good stay for the price (we paid $139 per night for 2 nights). The room was small but clean, although the elevator had a strange aroma. The staff was ... average. Definitely not rude, but indifferent, as if they didn't really care that we were staying with them. The location was quiet and central to much of Manhattan. As others have said, the coffee house next door is fantastic. One caution if you are driving into NYC and planning to park: the parking garage, although close, had an incredibly rude attendant. Not only could I not understand what the angry gentleman was saying, but he literally peeled out in my car as he pulled it around for us to get in. I *think* he was mad because I didn't tip him, but I normally don't tip for rudeness. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Beware The Bed Bugs Dont Bite”
Reviews.Author: MrOanda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights, the accomodation was of an average standard comparable to a UK Travelodge except with the addition of bed bugs/ mites. I left the hotel covered in bites and with the fear my luggage had also been infested. I believe other budget hotels would be of the same if not better standard but without insects sharing your room.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Fiona_Thompson
Reviews.Content: I'm a few months late with my review but I loved the hotel! Fair enough it wasn't the Waldorf but it met our requirements! Thought everything looked really clean and tidy until the last day when we were looking under the bed and found a condom wrapper which was disapointing. Loved the breakfasts - managed to put on 10lb in 5 days with all those doughnuts! It was enough to keep you going nearly till tea time. Thought the staff on reception were very helpful and also the week day breakfast and room cleaning staff were very friendly indeed! Loved the Murray Hill diner just up the road - very popular on sunday mornings! The location was great we were quite handy for most things and all the walking helped burn off the calories from the breakfast!! This is a great place for tourists who are wanting a 'base' to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: Buddey
Reviews.Content: Easy check in. No view considering we wanted a smoking room and only the 4th and 5th floors are for smoking. We really weren't in the room all that much. Clean room and bathroom. Great water pressure for shower (Watch out for that step into the bathroom). No complaints regarding the slow elevator (Maybe they are reading the reviews and stepped it up a bit?) Italian restaurant next door (Trattoria Belvedere) was awesome. The owner was on premises and introduced himself to us and we also received a complimentary glass of Italian desert wine with our coffee. The service was wonderful. The food was incredible!!!! Deli down the street open 24 hours (what a godsend). Anticipating my next excursion to NY and would definitely book this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, if you don't mind bug bites!”
Reviews.Author: LLONYC
Reviews.Content: My company booked me in this hotel while I looked for an apartment. Like another reviewer, the room felt like a sauna when I walked in. I called the front desk and asked about air conditioning since it would only blow hot air... after telling me, "You don't need air conditioning," they sent someone up to "fix it," and by that, I mean they sent someone to open a window... which I didn't close during my entire stay (5 nights). Anyway, that was only a minor inconvenience. The reason why I departed early from what should have been a 3-week stay was that I was being eaten alive by bed bugs or spiders or something while I was sleeping. I was bitten 3 nights out of the 5 I was there... on the last night, I incurred 6 bites. I'm more allergic than most to bug bites, so they swelled to welts about 4" in diameter. It was quite unpleasant and made a great impression to my new co-workers at my new job. The hotel said they've never had such a problem... but the proof is undeniable, and I do have some lovely photos that I am not going to post at this time. But they exist. It's been a week and two days since I switched hotels... I have been bite-free ever since I left, so I'm pretty sure that all the little critters are still looking for another arm to bite at the great Ramada Eastside. I wasn't going to post reviews online, but Victor, the manager, has decided to not return my calls-- even though the front desk encouraged that I talk to him with my complaints. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to ANYONE. It's cheap for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Happiness in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: westtexgeo
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (incl. two teenagers) was looking for 'economical' accomodations for a few days around Christmas in Manhatten. After looking at numerous websites and lots of reviews, I decided on the Ramada. We've never been to New York City before, so it was a bit of a shot in the dark, but overall I was very pleased. One note on price. After getting over the relative high price of all NYC hotels, after booking the Ramada the price quoted, despite listing 4 total people on the reservation, was the 'single' price. The actual price for four was about $30 more per night. Make sure you double check the rate based on the actual number of people in the room. The hotel location turned out to be nearly ideal. Transit to/from LaGuardia was fairly painless, even leaving on a Friday afternoon. The hotel sits at 30th and Lexington, about a 5 minute walk from the nearest subway, 10 minutes from the Empire State Building, 15 minutes from Macy's and 20-25 minutes from Times Square. The hotel neighborhood is relatively quiet, with a number of 'hole-in-the-wall' restaurants nearby. We actually had dinner on Christmas night, when we arrived, across the street in a Chinese noodel house (ala The Christmas Story) but our biggest surprise was the quaint Italian restaurant (Trattoria Belvedere) right next store (yellow awning in picture). Moderately priced with a cozy atmosphere, I'd definately recommend this place if you want something good and very close. Our dinner for four, including a bottle of wine, was just over $100...a real bargain for NYC. The hotel itself was about what I expected. The room was small, so with two queen size beds there wasn't much elbow room, but everything was clean and the bathroom looked to be recently renovated. Our room was on the 11th floor, facing opposite 30th street and we barely ever noticed street noise. Could even see the Empire State Building from our window. The free continental breakfast was above average. The dining room and food layout was very clean and well stocked, with an attendant available for any need. The food included donuts, bagels, yogurt, cereal, fruit, microwavable pancakes, and a full range of beverages. Definately a cost-conscious bonus not needing to purchase breakfast everyday. One comment on the coffee. I'm not a coffee drinker, but my wife was less than thrilled with the home brew, but there's a coffee house next door (see picture) so for a buck fifty, you're covered. All in all we were very pleased with the choice, and based on price, would certainly consider returning our next time in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Eastside Great, but Beware the Heating System!”
Reviews.Author: Kara⪼ott
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor, once again, led us to a very good hotel in New York City. This one is exactly as described on Trip Advisor. $147 a night in late December! You cannot beat the price here. It was also clean and comfortable with a friendly staff. Even a small workout room and free breakfast. Great location. Close to the subway; close to just about everything in NYC. One word of advice: learn how to operate the heating system. Our room, the first night, felt more like a sauna. We turned the heating system "off" but it was still cranking out the heat. We opened the window, but then had to deal with the sounds of NYC! Anyway, we finally spoke with someone at the front desk. Evidently there is a "valve" on the bottom of the heating unit that should be "closed." Thanks to Trip Advisor and all who post on this extremely valuable site.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay again unless prices were extremely high at other hotels”
Reviews.Author: judi2
Reviews.Content: Read about applecore hotels.com in local paper. Prices were very steep at other hotels during Christmas. Read trip advisor reviews. Stayed one night at $242 including taxes. For that time of year, it was okay, but wouldn't recommend during low season. Very tiny rooms, step up to bathroom. Julie, staff member, not so friendly. We couldn't get smoking king, so we took queen even though fellow at desk said king would be ready when we got back. He had left and Julie was there and was very matter a fact that there were NO smoking rooms to begin with. That wasn't the end of the world! It is clean and in a good location and very nice people were staying there. Just be aware it's not at all like regular hotel rooms in NYC. We love the Affinia chain.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Watford_Wobble
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights during December 2006. OK, so the hotel is basic but is more than satisfactory. After catching the bus into Penn Street Station it was just a short 15 minute walk away. Check in was quick and easy. The room was just large enough and a bit of a squeeze. We found that the heating could not be turned down so it was rather hot in the room. The coffee making facilities weren't great but we managed with the filter machine that was provided. The free continental breakfast was a great start to the day. Again nothing fancy but got you off to a good start. Coffee, bagel, doughnuts, fruit it was all available together with a paper. We also had free internet access in the business room which again was great and we used several times. It's location is great for eating out. Loads of places going up Lexington Avenue to pop in and eat something. The coffee house next door is super. A must. The Italian resturant next door I can also recommend. So to sum up. Great location with just a 20 minute walk to Times Square, reasonable price, clean, friendly and quiet. I will be there again next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Canuk_in_the_City
Reviews.Content: While not overly fancy this hotel was great for our 6 night stay. Check in was quick and when we asked for extra towels and pillows they were delivered when we came back from dinner. The required number of towels were also replaced each day the room was cleaned so we never had to ask twice. The hotel is kept quite clean. Room size: it was a little small but keep in mind there were 4 adult women staying in it. It was large enough for the amount of time we spent there. Breakfast: it was great. There were muffins, bagels, fruit, yogurt and suprisingly waffles and pancakes. For those who were dissapointed in the breakfast your standards are way to high. It is free after all. With all the deli's and coffee shops surrounding the hotel i'm sure you can find a suitable alternative. Location: amazing. walking distance to empire state building and many pubs, restaurants, clubs, etc. It's only about a $7 cab ride to Times Square. I can't say enough good things about the location. There is a coffee house attached to the hotel that has the best vanilla latte and cocamochanut blended drink. Great service. Great coffee. The Italian restaurant on the other side of the hotel was amazing. The waiters were extremely attentive and friendly. The food was spectacular (i had the ravioli). We were so full afterwards none of us ordered dessert but the waiter brought over some fabulous tirimasu "on the house". it was amazing. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: minicooperdownunder
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights from September 25, 2006 and really liked it. My room on the 7th floor had a nice view south and the room was a good size and spotlessly clean. The room was cleaned and restocked early eachday and was ready on a couple of days when I came back at lunchtime. The breakfast downstairs was average for a continental buffet set up at a chain hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is good eastside a few blocks from 5th Avenue and the Empire State Building. Would stay here again. The only odd thing was that the bathroom was up one step which wasn't a problem for me but could be for some I guess. Great value for the price in New York.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: CUPCAKE415
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed here for my 30th birhday in April 2005. We took the train from Jersey to Penn Station at Madison Sq Gardens. The hotel is very close to everything, MSG, Times Sq, all the shopping, and Empire St Building. There was a deli right across the st for beer, breakfast sandwiches and drinks etc. Subway access about a block away. Easy to grab a cab. I didnt have any complaints about the hotel, we weren't in it much. The room was nice and clean. I would stay here again for the location. with friends, but would find something a little nicer and bigger for family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Suzie81
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at the Ramada Inn Eastside with no luggage as it had not followed us from Chicago and was supposed to come on the next flight, the girl at reception was quick to offer us a pack of toiletries each and direct us to the closest convienience store that was opened!! Quick check in. The rooms are average size but very clean and have air conditioning. Being on the 11th floor we had a great view! The cleaners were in every day of our 5 day trip to make the bed,empty bins,give us new towels and have a general tidy up! I enjoyed the breakfast, with cereals,fruit,bagels,pancakes,waffles,bread to make toast,donuts,tea,coffee and fruit juices, although my boyfriend said he would have prefered a hot breakfast but I def had no complaints!! This hotel is in a brilliant location, minutes from great nightlife, restaurants and shopping in every direction and all the usual siteseeing opportunities! I would definately return to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “It was GREAT!! Excellant location!”
Reviews.Author: e-14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the entire first week of June, 2006. It is in a very good location of Manhattan, close to everything, including the main Subway 6 line. Restaurants galore in the area. Lots to do! The free breakfast every morning was GREAT!! Stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This just blows my mind to hear and read all of the negative reveiws. My husband a professional comedian and myself stayed here in Dec, the week of Christmas. I plan on making reservations again in Jan 8-13. I fell in love with the clean simplicity of the hotel. Our room was spotless, We even set a Christmas Tree up in our room and hung stockings. It was home for the week, The staff were incredible. The breakfast was nice. I have read how hot the heat was in the rooms during winter months. We simply opened a window . It was great and cant wait to come back ,. Were making a move to the city shortly. Hey have you seen the flying roaches in FLORIDA? Even the RITZ has bugs. I have personally reccomended this hotel to 20 people and have all stayed. Very Happy with the accomedations. Sorry for those of you that didnt have a good stay .

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ramada - slept like a baby - great location - great price”
Reviews.Author: MellyMom
Reviews.Content: If you read all the other reviews - you will hear stories of bed bugs, old hotel, staff rude and unhelpful, but if you travel often and don't wish to spend a great deal of time in your hotel - and would rather spend the dollars saved on a great dinner - this is the place for you - we never saw any bed bugs and stayed three nights!!! The hotel is in a great location - the breakfast is adequate - the hotel is old - but that adds to it's charm. We found the staff to be very friendly and only too willing to indulge in World Cup Soccer conversation. Please do check out the most excellent coffee shop next door Brasil Coffee house - it is a gem and I cannot stress enough try the Italian restaurant Trattoria Belveder - this is by far one of the most finest italian establishments we have ever frequented. Please do ask them about their specials - the host insisted we try his dessert - which was complimentary - it was all we could do to make it next door and collapse we were so full!!! This location is so close to everything - you will be amazed. For the ladies with tired feet after a day's walking next to the Trattoria - there's an excellent spa - with pedicures for $20 - they even gave a free back massage!!! Have fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: jane7518
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in this hotel in June and would have moved out immediately if I was able to find anywhere else to stay. The entire hotel and corridors smell mouldy. When checking my room on the final day, I peeked under the bed to make sure nothing had been left behind. I found that I had been sharing my accomodation with a pile of used condoms. They were not mine, and had therefore been there all week. I reported my disgust to the management but the entire response was a mumbled appology. I would never ever recommend this hotel or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's fine”
Reviews.Author: AndrewDoughty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights at the end of April, our favourite hotels and all other well know (and more expensive) being fully booked. We found it a perfectly acceptable place to stay. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. A good llcation, being neither too noisy or too quite. All in all remarkable value for money and whilst not the standard of hotel that we would normally book into, we were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price and the city. I spent 3 nites here and with my AAA discount the room rate was $140 per nite. Located on the east side, the hotel is a bit off the beaten path. However, the hotel is a short walk to the subway (Lexington line). Or if you prefer, the bellman will quickly hail a cab for you. The rooms are small but comfortable and newly renovated. Room rate included cable TV, some nice views of the city, and free breakfast. Staff is friendly enough (NY standards) with efficient room service. I have found a new favorite place to stay when in Manhattan and it is the Ramada, east side.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location - friendly and capable staff. Recommended for a traveler seeking great value for $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Take my breath away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I came to the Ramada Eastside Hotel, I was expecting a lot less for the price I paid. I have travelled the globe many times over, stayed in hotels around the world and definitely would count this among the few really great experiences I have had. Everyone tried to wow me! Off season prices with 5 star service - what more could one ask. I was pleasantly surprised at the Front Desk's prompt service - they even asked me which way I'd like to face - they had rooms facing North/South on the Avenue as well as street facing, non- smoking ofcourse, and I got a room high up facing the north of Manhattan - beautiful view. The rooms were delightful and sooooo clean - I couldn't find a speck of dust anywhere. The sheets were white and soft and smelled so wonderful after a long flight. When we asked for extra pillows, we were told they were in the closet-which they were. I had my two kids (one girl and one boy)with me and although we had a room with 2 queen beds, we all wanted our own beds, so they sent up a rollaway at a small fee to take care of that problem - all in a matter of minutes. We all drink tea and when we asked, the coffee in the room was promptly replaced with tea-bags. Breakfast was more than adequate - the kids were pampered by the attending lady who was more than gracious, going out of her way to get us whatever we needed. I needed a postcard mailed and the front desk took care of it right away-even though I had no stamps! With 2 growing kids jumping around New York, we constantly needed food, and although there are no microwaves or fridges in the rooms, the Manager invited us to use his fridge and the microwave in the B'fast room whenever we required-saved us quite a bit there. Besides which, my son's antibiotic was easily stored overnight in the fridge. This is what makes the difference - makes you feel at home so to speak. The next day, although we were checking out, we were able to store our luggage at no cost while we did the rounds of the sights-the front desk gave us some really useful tips-how to get up to the Empire State building viewing deck without waiting in line-can't beat that huh! When we left for JFK, we had a limo waiting at the same price as a yellow cab. Beats trying to flag a cab down at rush hour while you're glancing at your watch every 30 seconds. All in all a fabulous experience - I've since recommended it to atleast 20 people - its a secret little hideaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ramada East Side last Month and found it to be a real nice place. The coffee shop "Brasil Coffee House" has the best coffee. Rooms were very clean and the staff helpful. Complimentary breakfast was not expected but came as a bonus. will recommend every one travelling to NYC. Best kept secret in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Better to Sleep With Homeless in Central Park Than Use This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I Meant to write this a lot earlier to warn people about this hotel, but have had to deal with damage from Hurricanes Ramada Inn Eastside- New York, New York 161 Lexington Avenue New York City, NY 10016 We have traveled extensively all over the world for over 30 years and stayed in a range of lodging ranging from super luxurious six stars to rooms with dirt floors that you had to lock the doors to keep the goats out. When you go to Manhattan and pay those prices you expect a certain level of accommodation. Not a hotel better suited for some third world country. My apology for any third world county who has such a hotel. Ramada Inn - New York, New York is dirty, small and had an odor problem. As soon as you entered the hotel you are hit by wall of smell somewhere between musty and old gym locker. Our family stayed in this hotel for six days. We would have moved out within 30 minutes if could have found another room. For some reason most of surrounding hotels were booked. The lobby was small and dirty with furnishing showing their age. There were two small elevators so we had to split into two groups. My daughter got stuck between floors for almost an hour. This elevator continued to do this the entire time we were there so we avoid it. The other elevator was soooo slow. It was much faster to walk. Not sure they ever fixed it. Even now there may be some poor guest trapped. The hallway to our room had musty smell of mold. Although we had requested a non-smoking room our room had the odor of stale cigarettes and half cleaned ashtrays littered the room. I wonâ€™t tell you how the bathroom smelled. The seat to the toilet was broken and if you did not sit just right you would slide right off the toilet onto the floor. Despite numerous requests over six days nothing was done. Bath tub was filthy (could tell by the pubic hair the previous occupant was a red head) and the drain control had a jagged piece of metal sticking out is side. The grout between the tiles had a nice coating of slimy blackish mildew. This is the only time I can remember on vacation going out to corner market and buying a bottle of bleach and scrubbing pad to clean the bathroom so we could use it. Very low water pressure and at best it was luke-warm. Tried to adjust the temperature and the faucet knob literally came off in my hand. Found major dust bunnies and debris of previous occupants in the space between the bed and the wall. There was no tv remote in the room. Called the front desk and got nothing but promises. Had to wait until the occupants of a nearby room checked out and why the made cleaned that room got their TV remote. When we checked into the room the lightbulb to the reading lamp was burned out, called down to request it be replace. Said it would be. After several days and several requests and no action we went out and bought our own lightbulb. The bedspreads on the beds were in terrible condition with a number of holes you could one or more fingers through. Then we get to the really fun part- meeting the roomâ€™s wildlife. On our first night after checking in going out to dinner and getting ready for bed, we pull back the bedspread and blanket and watch a number of black dots scurry across the sheets- LARGE fat bedbugs. I even managed to capture one in an empty pill bottle. Took a picture of it for proof and I will post in the picture. I immediately called the front desk and they said they would take care of it. How they took care of it was to ignore the problem and continue to use the same sheets. The reason I know this is there was a stain on one of the sheets and it was the same sheet night after night. It not a very pleasant thing to have to strip off the sheets from your bed, take them out into the hallway and shake them vigorously to get rid of any wildlife. Were talking doing this for five nights in a row. Despite this the sheets felt itchy. Then we had the world famous game called â€œChase the cockroaches up the walls as you take a showerâ€� Donâ€™t get too close or they might jump on you. New York Roaches are well known for being aggressive and nasty. See a race in progress in my pictures I have posted about this hotel Meeting the hotelâ€™s wildlife continued at it Complimentary Continental Breakfast. Bagels were stale, juice had an off taste, fresh fruit had some pieces beginning to rot, flies and nats buzzing around food. Got a great picture of one when he landed on our table. I think he is smiling. What do you think? See picture I have posted. The bananas were in such bad condition they should have been buried rather then served to human beings. All it took was one exposure and a resulting queasy stomach and during the rest of our stay we ate breakfast elsewhere. Among the Amenities offered were Computers with Internet access. Which was very true if you can find one that works or you can try and use a keyboard with most of the letters and number worn off. What the hotel does not tell you is that they do not provide printers. I found this out when I was in the process of trying to check in for my flight and wanted to print my boarding pass. I was informed at the front desk I would have to use the next door cybercafe. This meant you would have to pay by the minute to use the internet. I found out later from front desk that this was owned by the hotel. Nice way to earn a few extra buck from something that was suppose to be a free Amenities. Then we come to the management and staff of the hotel. By their actions and response to questions asked and various requests by guests, they seemed to look at us guests as some sort of ill smelling bottom feeding scum sucking creatures and they were deities who like Job in the bible was cursed with the affliction of having to put up with them. Not only were they not responsive or helpful, they were ant-responsive and anti-helpful going out of their way to make the guest feel small when they dared disturbed important activities of reading a newspaper, talking to their girlfriends on the phone or just staring out the window. While the price may seem right, the experience is not worth it. There are a lot better hotels than this in the area for about the same money. NYC is a fantastic place. Why ruin your visit by staying here. Good Luck, See The World and Stay Safe

Reviews.Title: “Clean but old and hot”
Reviews.Author: Jlzywales
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in December. The best thing was that the hotel was clean. There were holes in the bedspread....but at least it was clean. Of course it is small like most hotels in New York. The worst part was the heater. It blew hot air even when turned off. We had to open the window just to be able to breathe. The heater also made a noise like someone banging a hammer all night. Breakfast was fine ( bagels, toast, coffee, juice).

Reviews.Title: “it was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the ramada was a great place to stay! im a normal college senior and took a trip out there with my best friend just to have fun and meet boys! to be honest! and the hotel was fab! me and my best are gold collar people! we dont live in slums (no offense anyone) so we know quality! but it was great super clean! the maid was sooo nice and cute she helped us with any question we had, anything we needed! we seened her everyday, which is nice to see a familiar face, it felt comfortable. the again was nice and clean! breakfast, work out room, everything u dont need! lol! the service was nice but the location was just a bit much for me! thats the only prob! safe suroundings just a little too far from the action! but the cleanest nicess place ever!!! trust us! we are just normal, spoiled, clothes conciences college students!

Reviews.Title: “Merry Christmas 2005 at the Ramada”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent the entire week of Dec 20-27th 2005 at this hotel, and LOVED it!! First off NYC is crampted its the beauty of this beast The rooms are small but so are the owned and rented apartments in this city. Im shocked with all of the negaitve comments on this hotel. We were greeted at what ever time of the day, We were blown away by how CLEAN the whole hotel is. The staff couldnt do enough for us ! All we had to do is ask. Rays Pizza is awesome and is to the left on Lexington as you come out of the hotel a couple short NYC blocks (Very good food and priced very cheap!) The breakfast was good just your basics, but a good start of getting something in your tummy to start your day. Murray Hill is a great neighborhood . Very easy to walk to anything! We know we happened to be there the day of the Transit Strike, but after 3 days we were using our MTA passes. I think the Hotel is wonderful . Just wish we could always book a room there at 100.00 a night we are relocating from Florida to NYC in about a year and will be making more trips up to NYC We had an incredible Christmas and to all of you a Happy New Year!

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: jilly62
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 5 times and all round value it was great! its only a 5 min walk to empire state building, staff were very helpful and the breakfast is a great start to the day. Rooms are cleaned every day and clean bedding and towels every day,also its quieter than being near the times square area.A tip is to keep checking the website as the prices change every few days and a bargain can often be had if you keep checking.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Alison127
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November for 4 nights with two friends. It was our first trip to New York. The room we had in the Ramada Inn was very clean, had comfortable beds, plenty of hot water and good shower pressure. We were on the eight floor and it was pretty quiet. Our toilet needed to be repaired during our stay and this was dealt with within 10 minutes of reporting it. The breakfast consisted of cereal, toast, bagels, fresh friut, doughnuts, very nice orange juice and lovely coffee. The location is also good for getting around Manhattan. On my next visit to New York I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: toptaffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in October 2005. The best thing about the hotel was the location - a few minutes walk from the empire state building. Our room was very comfortable, clean and quiet with two double beds, large TV and large bathroom with bath and shower. Breakfast is served in a curious basement room. However, the food was adequate and it made a good start to the day! The only downside was the attitude of the staff on reception. On checking in they didn't even respond when I asked to check in and wasn't even sure that they'd heard me until they produced the form to sign. The area itself is quite quiet, but there are plenty of good restaurants on Lexington Av and it's worth trying a curry on the curry hill!

Reviews.Title: “Coudn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: josydez
Reviews.Content: I was in Ny on business and stayed at this hotel Oct 29 - Nov 2nd. After reading some of the reviews I was a little hestitant, but it was a last minute thing and the price was right. The room was perfectly adequate. It was a bit small but just fine for one (or two) adults. Most importantly it was clean. No bugs, critters or the like. The area is actually quiet during the night. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (2 persons) have been there for a one week stay from 17. Sep. 05 to 24. Sep. 05, our first trip to New York. The personnel was very friendly and helpful. The room (one Queen bed) was big enough for two persons, including a huge TV. The included continental breakfast was served in a very clean room and was satisfactory for starting the day . Also the possibility to use one of the two PC's (including free Internet access) in the business center was useful. This is a perfect hotel for tourists who want to stay budget (139$ plus tax, but depends on bed type), but not want to have bad surprises. The location (30th Street, Lexington Ave.) is great. See also the other hotels of this small hotel chain and reserve directly on the cooresponding hotel sites. In contrast to some other reviews I cannot say that it smells of smoke in the Ramada Inn. Try to get a room above the 5th floor and on the side to the 30th street, which should be more quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Stay far, far away!!”
Reviews.Author: Nolegirl1
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a girls weekend in NYC (Sept. 30th - Oct. 2). This particular hotel was chosen for the value of 4 people in one room ($50/night per person). I honestly don't know how 4 of the girls slept in this tiny room. I shared a room with only one person and we barely had enough space for our stuff. Our room was $199/night and that was with a discount, so in my opinion, it is no value hotel!!! Honestly, this hotel was probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. It was dirty, small and the entire place smelled like smoke (the lobby included). The elevators were extremely slow and they were super tiny. I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for better...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ...at least not for what we paid. I don't understand the bad reviews I read on this site before we left. They must be from less experienced travellers because we quite enjoyed our 7 day, 8 night stay. We stayed on the 7th floor and it was a quiet room, the odd siren or horn could be heard at night but we were never actually awoken by any of this. The bedroom itself was smallish, which I expected in NYC, but it was comfortable. We had some closet space and a dresser which helped for our week-long stay. The queen bed was comfortable but I'd ask for extra pillows. The bathroom made up for it-big enough for two of us to get ready at once(plus my girlfriend enjoyed not having to pack her hairdryer). We were especially concerned about cleanliness. No worries, our room was cleaned everyday and although the staff was not always cheery they were certainly never rude to us. And no, there were no bugs or mice. The continental breakfast was simple but good-coffee, juices, cereal, porridge, doughnuts, bagels and fruit. It was nice to have access to the internet in the hotel as well. The location was fine...a couple of minutes by foot from a subway, 5 minutes by foot from the Empire State building and 15-20 minutes by foot to Times Square. We weren't on an extreme budget but the money we saved by staying here allowed us to spend elsewhere. If you aren't wanting to spend loads of time in your room (we were in our room maybe 10-11 hours out of the day-basically just to sleep and unwind) and want a central, safe, clean location this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean room”
Reviews.Author: bgonner
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights; front desk staff was busy (fully booked) but helpful. Room was small, with an above average shower, very clean especially considering the age of the hotel. Good value and location away from busier parts of Manhattan. Near a great French restaurant, La Petite Auberge. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff/blood in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: washdcsjf
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. The front-desk staff were rude and unhelpful (and I don't mean New York gruffness which does not bother me) and the bathroom was not clean -- dust bunnies and most disturbingly, blood! Front desk staff did not care. I wrote to Ramada when I got back home and was assured the general manager would contact me (I neither asked for nor expected anything other than an apology and an assurance that he would address these issues with his staff) and have not heard anything. Clearly these customer service issues start at the top.

Reviews.Title: “Most Terrible Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst experience ever! New York trip was ruined due to unfriendly staff, horrible attitude towards the guests. I have had a decent experience with the Ramada Inn's in other locations but this was the worst hotel experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Ramada is a good budget hotel. We stayed here for six nights. My husband and I wanted somewhere comfortable and clean and the Ramada was certainly both of these. The breakfast in the morning is good (and complimentary) and set us up for the day ahead. My only criticism is that I did not know what AAA meant (as I am from the UK) so the quote I got with Expedia when booking it was misleading. The AAA is a the american version of AA and apparently you get a discount only if you are a AAA member. I had a heated argument with the reception lady about this and she refused to give me the rate I had booked at as I did not have one of these AAA cards (my AA card was not good enough). I even showed her my email print out that I got sent by Expedia with my booking reference number on it, the hotel address, the dates of my stay and the rate i booked at but this was not evidence enough for the receptionist. After this shaky and disappointing start (and 45 mins of arguing with the receptionist and manager) I decided I wasn't going to let this blight the rest of my hols and conceded to paying $200 odd more than I had originally agreed to. OK, that I have had my rant, it was a good clean hotel. Free internet and good breakfast bar that was regularly topped up and kept clean. Susie

Reviews.Title: “an Okay hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in July. I must say the location of the hotel is great, close to everything and if you can't walk to your destination a cab ride will be less then $10 (we went to Soho and the Meatpacking district mostly). Our hotel was on the 12th floor and had great views of Lexington Ave and the Chrysler Building. The room was a bit small and the bathroom was almost as large as the bedroom, which I thought was weird. There was also a ceiling to floor window in the bathroom, but instead of having curtains the window was painted over with paint. Yeah it doesn't make any sense? Also the water pressure was TERRIBLE! It would take 10 minutes to warm up and it was like showering under a leaky faucet. I would do as much washing in the sink I could before trying to get into the shower. I have to say the room was always cleaned and the air conditioner worked really well.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, simple, affordable accommodataion in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights after stayng in The New York Helmsley, near Grand Central Station. The move to this hotel was planned so that we could experience the Midtown area. The hotel is in a good location, where the streets are less busy than around Times Square. You're close to the subway and there are several cafe's and restaurants around the hotel. You are a short walk from the Murray Hill area, where you can sit in Madison Square Park, under the shadow of the flat-iron building. It's a nice area. The hotel was fine. Less formal than the Helmsley but I found it more comfortable and the price is more affordable too. We had clean towels every day and the room was cleaned/bed made etc every day. We stayed on the 6th floor, in a non-smoking room (as we had specified when booking through Expedia). The water pressure was fine in the en-suite bathroom, which was small but clean and well laid out. The bed was comfortable - not too soft, nor too hard. We didn't eat the complimentary breakfast - eating out in New York is so easy and affordable that we chose to skip the continental breakfasts and eat in one of the many eateries nearby. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful. We had trouble with the electronic key on a couple of occasions, but the staff at the front desk were quick to respond. My only other dealings with the staff happened when we would access our safety deposit box each day (a complimentary service). The room had an air-conditioning unit which worked fine but we still felt the room was too warm at night. We stayed over the memorial day weekend and found the weather outside to be very hot, so that probably explains the warm room. The air-conditioning *was* doing its job, it was obviously competing against some very warm weather. I would definitely stay here again and found the area to be very safe and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Inn is in a good hotel in a great location. It's walking distance to almost everything (that means if you like to walk!!). The front desk folks were very pleasant. We got to our hotel very early in the morning (730am), however check in time is at 3pm. The front desk manager noticed how tired we were and checked us in at about 8am or so. Very nice of him. This is a great hotel to stay in if you don't plan on staying in the room too much. The ONLY problem that we faced is the outside noise in the middle of the night. It's true what they say, "the city NEVER sleeps". at 2 am you can hear cab drivers honking, the sirens of the ambulence and cops.... Not as bad as it sounds, but it did annoy me a night or two. Overall the place is affordable, in a great location and one of the nicest one in the surrounding areas! Have fun on your trip....!!!

Reviews.Title: “really okay, but not great”
Reviews.Author: sailsail
Reviews.Content: My experience was similar to others. Despite a confirmation that clearly stated I had reserved a non-smoking room, I was told too bad 'we don't have any'. One has the feeling the front desk is numb to complaints. I accepted the smoking room and it was indeed perfumed worse than a rental car. But I guess that's better than the odor of stale cigarettes. I did however still smell the slight musty smell of mold in the hallways. Being prepared by another reviewer for the loose shower turney-thing helped me gingerly get the shower to work without the handle falling off which it was close to doing... Other than those 3 or 4 things - the room seemed clean, small and functional with coffeemaker, wireless internet access, continental breakfast and small business center all for 125. night. A rip off - no, but not a fabulous find either.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was happy with the hotel. For the budget consciuos traveler I highly recomend this hotel. It's in a great location and readily accesible to some NY attractions. Our room was small but the bathroom was not very confined. For the amount of time we spent in the room it was adequate. Our room was cleaned daily and the staff was nice and polite. The hotel is old so you do have the smell of mold that is distinctly covered with the smell of cleaning products. Besides that I dont have anything negative to say. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: sluv77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Inn Eastside on May 6-8, 2005 while visting NYC for several Yankees games. The room was tiny, but adequate and definitely worth the price! The location is great....within walking distance to the Empire State Building and great restaurants and shops. We were impressed with the food and the price (very reasonable) at the Murray Hill Diner for breakfast, only a block away. Also, many Indian restaurants are right around the corner. Definitely try Curry in a Hurry! The subway line is right around the corner (the 33rd Street subway and the 28th Street subway).....one stop away from Grand Central/42nd Street and a quick trip to Little Italy and Chinatown. The only negative we found in the room was the lack of water pressure. The shower provided barely enough water pressure to get the shampoo out of your hair. On the third morning, the entire hotel had no water for over 3 hours! We were unable to shower this day, and only received a 10% discount for this inconvience. Despite this, we would definitely stay there again. Great bargain for NYC!

Reviews.Title: “The best your money can buy”
Reviews.Author: hlevenst
Reviews.Content: Maybe the best budget hotel in Manhattan. The rooms are not so big, but clean and featuring some amenities only found in upper category's hotels. Extraordinary location, quite (yes, it's possible a quite hotel in NYC) and close to main attractions. Subway is a block away and the staff are also ok. For $80 a night you won't find better place. Lots of inexpensive deli's and restaurants right through the door.

Reviews.Title: “Good Inexpensive Option for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Clark_W_Griswold
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a peak April Saturday night when most other hotels were sold out. Front desk staff were helpful from the time I called to confirm my reservation to the time we checked out. Room #911 had a view of the Chrysler building from the bedroom and the Empire state Building from the bathroom. Our small room was very clean, and the bath was a decent size with no problems with water pressure. Temperature control worked fine and there was a coffee pot and supplies for making coffee & tea. It is not fancy, but a basic accommodation in a safe area. Breakfast was plentiful and the serving area was clean. Although I prefer a location further north for my own convenience, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: tubman
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much for the price, but was pleasantly surprised to find a generously-sized (by NYC standards) queen room and bath. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was actually attractive and appeared to have been recently renovated. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the continental breakfast was decent. I've had far worse in NYC for more money. The neighborhood is safe, but there's not a whole lot going on in the immediate vicinity; the subway is nearby and taxis are plentiful. This is not a destination hotel, but a safe, clean, comfortable place to spend the night. In other parts of the city, you wouldn't blink an eye to pay twice as much for the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of little problems”
Reviews.Author: joe02joe
Reviews.Content: My company probably booked me into the cheapest hotel in midtown Manhattan. For three nights, Mar 27-30 2005, the price per night was 89, 99, and $119. For that price you get a lot of problems. First thing upon getting to my room, I had to call back down to the front desk because I had no TV remote. By the time the guy came up to the room with a new one, I had a list of other problems. 1: toilet would not flush. 2: shower water handle fell right off when you touch it. The guy fiddled around with the toilet until it flushed. As for the shower handle, he looked at it and determined that a screw was missing. Not that he was going to expend any energy to fix it. More of an informational, "That's why" type of thing. Also later I was disappointed to find out that the fitness room was not open (renovation), the water pressure was just a trickle of lukewarm (at best) water, and worst of all, the heater just would not heat up the room at night to a comfortable level. it was not even that cold outside... but it was that cold inside too. The room had a strong smell of perfume, no bugs... and it was full of ashtrays, even though I had requested a non-smoking room. I would take my chances almost anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It was awful”
Reviews.Author: berrie2234
Reviews.Content: We were very unhappy with this hotel. We took it because it was cheap, but you definately get what you pay for in this world. The sheets were itchy, and there were long waits for the elevators. The cleaning staff use one of the two elevators for sheets during the day. And the rooms were very small.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for travelers on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: ljcooper
Reviews.Content: This was a nice little hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed there from March 12-15. We got a room on the 4th floor facing the front of the building, I thought it would be noisy but I was pleasantly surprised. The room was cleaned and the bed made up daily which was nice. We got a smoking room because everything else was booked up, but thankfully it smelled fresh and nothing like smoke. Another plus was the free wireless internet which was great since we had brought a laptop along. We only went to the continental breakfast once and it was the normal fare; doughnuts, bagels, ceral and the like. The location of the hotel was alright, within walking distance to the Empire state building and Macy's and the shops on 34th St. It's also only a few blocks from the 28th St. Subway stop for the green line. The m16 bus on 34th St. will take you straight to the Port Authority bus terminal. There's also a nice Mexican restaurant called La Cocina a block away on 3rd Avenue, and the hotel is surrounded by indian restaurants which we were too unadventurous to try. The downside was that it was hard to keep the room at a comfortable temperature. When the heat was on it got really hot, and when it was off it was too cold. The elevator was also a little slow and smelled strongly of cleaning products which wasn't that bad considering what it could have smelled like. Also the front desk wouldn't change four dollars into quarters for us, so if you're planning on taking the bus which only takes quarters remember to bring them with you! Overall this hotel was nice and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JdWals
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Ramada Inn via the Apple Core website based on the reviews on tripadvisor and was not let down. A nice comfortable and simple hotel that was clean and met with our expectations. In a great location to explore midtown Manhattan but still just that little bit outside the hectic tourist and shopping areas so you can catch your breath. A ten minute walk to the Empire State and Macy's. Handy small internet cafe right next door and a lovely Italian restaurant at the other side (both seperate businesses). Staff were very helpful and we were able to leave our luggage with them after check out without any problem. They also booked us a cab back to the airport which was great. Would have no hesitation in staying there again the next time we are in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Second time I've stayed here. For the price you can't really complain, plus as the hotel is only a couple of years old it is in good condition. Room was smaller than my last one but still an okay size for a double, with built in wardrobe and a decent sized bathroom. Plus how many New York hotels give you a breakfast included for these prices, even if it is only a Continental one? Location on Lexington and 31st is at the lower end of midtown but very handy for the Empire State Building, Macys and Herald Square. Overall, in a good location for exploring New York. The staff were courteous and will happily store bags securely after check out at noon - useful as European flights usually leave New York in the evening. Small cafe (separate business) located in the building by the entrance. Handy for getting a snack, paper or to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel...”
Reviews.Author: neslyn
Reviews.Content: this is a relatively small hotel ... the staff is quite nice, as well as the service ... the rooms are a bit old, but hey... its NYC! the only problem was that whenever you turned on the a/c all that would come out was HOT air... overall... it's worth the price!
